TITLE: Russian tank destroyed in Ukraine is put on display outside Russian embassy in Germany
SUMMARY: Activists in Berlin, Germany have parked a Russian tank destroyed in Ukraine outside its embassy there on the one-year anniversary of the conflict.

TITLE: Nigerian police arrest lawmaker accused of carrying $500K in cash the day before elections
SUMMARY: Nigerian police arrested Chinyere Igwe, a lawmaker who allegedly carried $500,000 in cash a day before elections. It is illegal to move over $10,000 of undeclared cash in Nigeria.

TITLE: Yale professor suggesting ‘mass suicide’ of elderly 'inappropriate' but understandable: Japanese commentator
SUMMARY: Japanese commentator Yoko Ishii weighed in on a Yale professor's suggestion that Japan's elderly commit mass suicide to alleviate its aging population burdens.

TITLE: Dutch parliamentary inquiry releases damning report into government's handling of natural gas extraction
SUMMARY: A report into the Dutch government's handling of natural gas extraction that caused multiple earthquakes was released by the country's parliamentary inquiry.

TITLE: Red flags: China, North Korea flex military capabilities as fears over new conflicts continue to rise in Asia
SUMMARY: Taiwan detected some 37 Chinese aircraft and six navy vessels, while the Philippines found over two dozen Chinese navy vessels in the South China Sea on Friday.

TITLE: Father of girl who died from bird flu also contracts the virus, health officials say risk of spreading is low
SUMMARY: A Cambodian girl died after contracting bird flu earlier this week. The girl's father recently tested positive for the illness but has mild symptoms.

TITLE: Madeleine McCann disappearance: Polish police reportedly dispute woman's claims she is missing British girl
SUMMARY: Polish police are disputing a young woman's claims that she may be missing British toddler Madeleine McCann, who disappeared from a vacation in Portugal in 2007.

TITLE: 10 killed in riots in Indonesia’s restive Papua province
SUMMARY: Ten people have been killed and over 20 others injured in riots in Indonesia’s restive Papua province. The protests started Thursday afternoon amid rumors of a child kidnapping.

TITLE: TikTok claims EU didn't notify them of continent-wide employee ban
SUMMARY: TikTok representatives claim that the European Commission never consulted them regarding a temporary ban on the Chinese-owned app for all employees' work devices.

TITLE: M23 rebels gain more ground in Congo
SUMMARY: The Congo's M23 rebel group, which identifies itself as a Rwandan affiliate, has captured the village of Mushaki in the nation's North Kivu province.

TITLE: China unveils peace plan to wary Zelenskyy
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is cautiously welcoming of prospective Chinese involvement in brokering a peace deal in the ongoing Russo-Ukrainian conflict.

TITLE: Italy's high court upholds tough prison regime for militant
SUMMARY: Italy's high court has upheld a tough prison regime for an Italian left-wing militant. The man has been on hunger strike since October to protest the prison regime for terrorists.

TITLE: Drone strike in Syria kills 2 al-Qaida-linked operatives
SUMMARY: A drone strike in Syria has killed two al-Qaida-linked operatives riding a motorcycle. The attack was believed to have been carried out by the U.S.-led coalition.

TITLE: UN condemns Haitian gang violence spike
SUMMARY: Haitian gang Baz Gran Grif has taken control of numerous communities, killing at least 69 people and leaving several police stations abandoned as a result.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: What Russia can and can't afford
SUMMARY: Vladimir Putin wants Russians to feel like there is no war and life is normal. But how long can it last? Economic editor Peter Mironenko on Putin’s purse strings.

TITLE: Yemeni rebels frustrated by leader's calls to delay seccession
SUMMARY: Southern separatists in Yemen condemned statements by a close ally insinuating that secession from the Houthi rebel-dominated north of the country should be delayed.

TITLE: Argentina mom and her female partner sentenced in murder, sexual abuse of 5-year-old son: reports
SUMMARY: An Argentinian mother and her transgender partner were sentenced to life in prison for killing the mother's five-year-old son in November 2021.

TITLE: French woman bites off tongue of suspected would-be rapist in country illegally
SUMMARY: A French woman reportedly gave police part of a man's tongue after he tried to rape her while she was walking her dog, according to French media.

TITLE: Chinese officials confronts US diplomat, draws 'red lines' over Hong Kong speech
SUMMARY: U.S. Consul General Gregory May incensed officials of the Chinese Communist Party by warning that Hong Kong may fall from its status as an international business hub.

TITLE: Iran says new long-range cruise missile can strike US ships within 1,000 miles
SUMMARY: The Iranian government unveiled a new long-range cruise missile on state media, claiming it would be able to strike U.S. warships 1,000 miles away.

TITLE: Behind bars: Thousands of criminals, including notorious MS-13 gang members, start filling new 'mega prison'
SUMMARY: The new Center for the Confinement of Terrorism can hold upwards of 40,000 in its eight buildings. Watched over by hundreds of guards, El Salvador officials call it "inescapable."

TITLE: Body found in search for British actor Mackenzie Crook's missing sister-in-law Laurel Aldridge
SUMMARY: A body was found on Friday during the search for Laurel Aldridge, the missing sister-in-law of actor Mackenzie Crook, as West Sussex authorities work to identify the body.

TITLE: Hong Kong model's ex-husband, family, arrested after body found dismembered
SUMMARY: Hong Kong police arrested four people related to the dismemberment and murder of Abby Choi, who's a model, accusing her ex-husband and his family of killing her.

TITLE: Biden’s speech rallying NATO was all for show, says retired lieutenant general. Here’s why
SUMMARY: Lt. Gen. Keith Kellogg said without fulfilling their pledge to spend 2% of GDP on defense, NATO members won't be able to come to the aid of their allies if called.

TITLE: Russian warlord's fiery feud with Putin's generals threatens to bury Russia's ambitions
SUMMARY: Yevgeny Prigozhin has increasingly put himself at odds with the Russian military establishment, openly criticizing failures in Ukraine to boost his own profile.

TITLE: Trans psychologist warns against law letting minors legally change gender: 'Unexpected consequences'
SUMMARY: A transgender clinical psychologist expressed concerns about "unexpected consequences" regarding a Spanish law allowing minors as young as 12 to legally change their gender.

TITLE: Volodymyr Zelenskyy predicts Putin will fall to own people: Russians will 'find a reason to kill the killer'
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russian President Vladimir Putin will fall to an uprising from his own people. He argues that Russians will "find a reason."

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: In Russia 'there is no such thing as support in a non-free society'
SUMMARY: What a year of war has done to Russian society and why they have put up with it. Russia expert Ekaterina Schulmann takes stock of society

TITLE: Italian coast guard says dozens dead after migrant craft crashes off coast, alleged human trafficker charged
SUMMARY: At least 60 migrants are reportedly dead, and at least one allege human trafficker among some 80 survivors has been charged after a makeshift wooden vessel crashed off Italy's coast.

TITLE: Expert sounds alarm on new law that allows minors to change gender without parental consent
SUMMARY: A transgender clinical psychologist expressed concerns about "unexpected consequences" regarding a Spanish law allowing minors as young as 12 to legally change their gender.

TITLE: Another US agency assesses COVID-19 origin likely a Chinese 'lab leak': report
SUMMARY: The U.S. Energy Department reportedly joins the FBI in assessing the COVID-19 pandemic originated from an accidental Chinese lab leak, an update to a 2021 intelligence report says.

TITLE: Italy shipwreck: Coast guard says dozens dead after migrant craft crashes off coast
SUMMARY: At least 60 migrants are reportedly dead, and at least one allege human trafficker among some 80 survivors has been charged after a makeshift wooden vessel crashed off Italy's coast.

TITLE: North Korean parents to get prison time for letting their kids watch Hollywood, foreign films: report
SUMMARY: North Korean parents will face prison if their children watch South Korean or Hollywood films as the government cracks down on foreign influences.

TITLE: Chaplain reported as terrorist for questioning LGBTQ activists digs in for legal battle
SUMMARY: Bernard Randall is appealing an employment tribunal ruling against him after he sued his former employer for allegedly firing him over a sermon that questioned LGBTQ activists.

TITLE: Mexican president goes viral for claim he has photo proof of mythical woodland elf
SUMMARY: Mexico President Andrés Manuel López Obrador is going viral on Twitter after posting a photo of what he says is an "aluxe," a mythical Mayan elf-like creature.

TITLE: CIA director says he warned Russian counterpart against using nuclear weapons in Ukraine
SUMMARY: CIA director William Burns said he promised Russia's spy chief Sergei Naryshkin severe consequences from the United States if Moscow uses nuclear weapons on the Ukrainian battlefield.

TITLE: Palestinian gunman shoots and kills two Israeli brothers in West Bank
SUMMARY: A Palestinian gunman shot and killed two Israeli brothers in the northern West Bank on Sunday, casting a shadow over peace talks that took place in Jordan.

TITLE: Russia ditches nuclear security amid China visit, ‘dangerous decade’ ahead, expert warns
SUMMARY: Russian President Putin's decision to suspend New START treaty renews global nuclear concerns as he expands ties with China, and a nuclear expert details how U.S. must respond.

TITLE: New 5.6 magnitude earthquake hits Turkey, killing one person
SUMMARY: Another earthquake has hit Turkey three weeks after a previous fatal quake devastated the region. Monday’s magnitude 5.6 quake killed one person and injured 69 others.

TITLE: Holy town in India, built on unstable terrain, is sinking
SUMMARY: Joshimath, a holy town located in the Himalayan mountains of India, is sinking. Hundreds of residencies became uninhabitable as fissures and cracks emerged.

TITLE: North Korea holds conference to improve farming sector amid food shortage
SUMMARY: North Korea's leader Kim Jong Un held a major political meeting to address the country's agriculture as the country battles one of its worst food shortage since Kim took power in 2011.

TITLE: Hundreds in Croatia spend night in cars, gas stations after snowstorm brings traffic to a halt
SUMMARY: A snowstorm in eastern Europe has snarled traffic in Croatia, Serbia, and Bosnia. Hundreds of Croatian residents had to spend the night in their cars or reception areas.

TITLE: Brexit deal: Rishi Sunak, EU enter 'final talks' on Northern Ireland Protocol
SUMMARY: British PM Rishi Sunak is hosting final talks with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen regarding the Northern Ireland Protocol to finally claim to have "got Brexit done."

TITLE: Egypt's foreign minister meets with Syrian President Bashar Assad, promises to deliver more earthquake aid
SUMMARY: Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry promised to deliver more earthquake aid when he met with Syrian President Bashar Assad in Damascus on Monday.

TITLE: United Nations suspends flights in eastern Congo following helicopter attack
SUMMARY: Last week a United Nations helicopter was attacked in eastern Congo. The UN decided to suspend flights above eastern Congo following the attack.

TITLE: Japan eases coronavirus measures for tourists from China by only testing random passengers
SUMMARY: Japan will only be testing random passengers from China in the country's latest attempt to ease COVID border measures. Direct flights from China will also be expanded to more airports.

TITLE: Brexit deal: Rishi Sunak, EU reportedly reach agreement on Northern Ireland Protocol
SUMMARY: British PM Rishi Sunak hosted final talks with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen regarding the Northern Ireland Protocol to finally claim to have "got Brexit done."

TITLE: Pakistani police arrest retired army general on charges of inciting the public against national institutions
SUMMARY: Retired Army General Amjad Shoaib of Pakistan was arrested on charges of inciting the public against national institutions. He is a supporter of former Prime Minister Imran Khan.

TITLE: Dead Hong Kong model Abby Choi's ex-husband, former in-laws detained on murder charges
SUMMARY: The ex-husband and former in-laws of Abby Choi have been detained and charged in the murder of the Hong Kong model after a skull and parts of her body were found dismembered.

TITLE: 'Hangry' woman's 911 call angers police, sparks public reprimand: 'Not a valid reason'
SUMMARY: Royal Canadian Mounted Police in Manitoba tweeted that 911 calls are only for emergencies after a woman called them over a long drive-thru line at Burger King.

TITLE: Germany seeks to set up new wind power network with its North Sea neighbors
SUMMARY: The German government wants to set up an offshore network of wind power lines with its North Sea neighbors, which could rectify bottlenecks in Europe’s energy market.

TITLE: 2 experts slam World Health Organization's investigation into sexual abuse allegations in Congo
SUMMARY: The WHO's investigation into sexual abuse allegations against their employees in Congo was "an absurdity," according to experts. Experts are upset no senior officials have been fired.

TITLE: Mexican army clashes with angry border residents after soldiers randomly fired into a pickup truck, killing 3
SUMMARY: Army soldiers in Mexico clashed with residents of border town Nuevo Laredo Sunday. The residents were angry after soldiers indiscriminately fired into a truck and killed three people.

TITLE: Hundreds protest in Baghdad to denounce a proposed law that would increase Iraq’s electoral district size
SUMMARY: People in Baghdad protested a law proposal aimed at increasing the size of Iraq’s electoral districts, which could possibly undermine independent candidates.

TITLE: The Philippines joins the US in search for missing Taiwanese fishing vessel carrying 6 people
SUMMARY: The Philippine coast guard has joined the U.S. and other Taiwanese counterparts in search for a Taiwanese fishing vessel that disappeared 10 days ago.

TITLE: Japan, New Zealand foreign ministers agree to speed up talks on intelligence sharing as China concerns grow
SUMMARY: Japan and New Zealand foreign ministers agreed to speed up talks regarding intelligence sharing as concerns about China continue to grow.

TITLE: Greta Thunberg protests clean wind farm on indigenous lands as human rights abuses
SUMMARY: Climate activist Greta Thunberg joined indigenous protesters to block the Norway Energy Ministry in protest of wind turbines on Sami lands.

TITLE: Japanese air force member sues government for allegedly failing to protect her from sexual harassment
SUMMARY: A serviceperson at Japan’s Air Self Defense Force has filed a lawsuit against the government. She claims that the government covered up her sexual harassment case for years.

TITLE: Islamic State land mines kill 10 workers, injure 12 others in central Syria
SUMMARY: A couple of land mines that were left behind by the Islamic State years ago were set off near Salamiyeh, Syria, which killed 10 workers and wounded 12 others.

TITLE: Israel calls up army battalions as serious violence hits West Bank following murder of Israeli brothers
SUMMARY: Tensions are rising in Israel following an uptick in terror attacks. On Sunday two Israeli brothers were murdered in cold-blood which led to violent rioting by Israeli settlers in a nearby Palestinian village.

TITLE: International Energy Agency says SUVs pose environmental issues, produce more greenhouse gas emissions
SUMMARY: The International Energy Agency says bigger cars pose environmental issues as they produce more greenhouse gases and require larger batteries.

TITLE: Germany pushes back on call to terminate government’s Facebook page over data privacy concerns
SUMMARY: The German government is refusing to take down its Facebook page after a federal commissioner urged its termination over data privacy concerns.

TITLE: Haiti's former interim Prime Minister Gérard Latortue dies at the age of 88
SUMMARY: The former interim prime minister of Haiti died at the age of 88. Gérard Latortue was the prime minister in the mid-2000s and helped rebuild the country after a coup.

TITLE: Montenegro lawmakers elect judges to country's top court, ending stalemate that threatened to halt NATO bid
SUMMARY: Montenegro's stalemate that threatened to halt the bid to join NATO has ended after lawmakers elected judges to the top court. The court is crucial to the country's rule of law.

TITLE: Kidnapped archaeologist, 2 others released after being held hostage in Papua New Guinea for ransom
SUMMARY: After being held hostage in Papua New Guinea for a week, New Zealand citizen and archaeologist Bryce Barker will finally return to Australia. Two other hostages were also released.

TITLE: Egypt's foreign minister pays earthquake-ravaged Turkey rare visit
SUMMARY: Egyptian Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry visited Turkey in his country's first high-level diplomatic visit to the earthquake-ravaged nation after years of political discord.

TITLE: Poland reports African swine fever outbreak in local livestock
SUMMARY: Poland has reported cases of African swine fever in five wild boar in the nation's northern region, the World Organisation for Animal Health announced Monday.

TITLE: Macao, the world’s biggest gambling hub, eases COVID-19 mask mandate
SUMMARY: The world’s biggest gambling hub, Macao, has eased its outdoor coronavirus mask mandate. Indoor venues including casinos will independently decide whether people need to mask.

TITLE: Pope Francis to visit Hungary at the end of April, will focus on European migration, Russia's war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Pope Francis is set to talk about migration to Europe and Russia's war in Ukraine when he visits Hungary in April. Francis will meet with Prime Minister Viktor Orban upon arrival.

TITLE: US condemns Russian withdrawal from nuclear weapons treaty
SUMMARY: Bonnie Jenkins, undersecretary of state for arms control, condemned Russia for its withdrawal from the New START agreement with the U.S.

TITLE: American citizen confirmed dead in West Bank terror attack
SUMMARY: A U.S.-Israel dual citizen was shot and killed in the West Bank Monday as the region is reeling from the proliferation of violence in recent days.

TITLE: Iran forces female students to attend hijab ‘counseling’ after months of women’s rights protests
SUMMARY: Dozens of female students across Iran have been forced to take a "mandatory counseling session" for failing to wear their hijab correctly.

TITLE: Yellen commits to further Ukraine aid in prime minister meeting
SUMMARY: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen committed to further spending on aid for Ukraine following a Monday meeting with the nation's prime minister.

TITLE: IRA splinter group claims responsibility for police shooting
SUMMARY: An Irish Republican Army splinter group has claimed responsibility for the shooting of a senior officer. The off-duty officer was shot in front of his son after coaching a soccer game.

TITLE: EU official defends talks with Big Tech on digital infrastructure upgrade
SUMMARY: The European Commission's digital policy czar defended talks with Big Tech companies over funding of Europe's outdated telecommunications infrastructure.

TITLE: Steven Seagal receives friendship award from Putin
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday bestowed the nation's Order of Friendship on actor Steven Seagal, a longtime sympathizer of his government.

TITLE: Belarus seeks lengthy prison terms for opposition leaders
SUMMARY: Belarus is seeking lengthy prison terms for five exiled opposition leaders. They are being charged with trying to overthrow the government and leading an extremist group.

TITLE: Serbia, Kosovo back EU diplomacy plan
SUMMARY: The leaders of Serbia and Kosovo, Aleksandar Vucic and Albin Kurti, implicitly agreed to a European Union-sponsored plan to ease tensions between the two nations.

TITLE: Hopes for Libyan unity dashed by electoral disputes
SUMMARY: The United Nations is attempting to broker a deal between rival Libyan political factions to establish concrete timelines for presidential and legislative elections.

TITLE: Fishermen find remains of missing man inside shark in Argentina
SUMMARY: A man missing in Argentina was found inside a nearly 5-foot long shark after fishermen caught the animal and discovered human remains inside.

TITLE: Iran reissues threat to 'kill Trump, Pompeo' for Soleimani death when announcing long-range cruise missile
SUMMARY: Iran has renewed threats to target former President Donald Trump and his former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo for the 2020 killing of Qasem Soleimani.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: Why Russians are so quick to blame the US
SUMMARY: Russians have a high approval rating for Putin and the Ukraine war which may be due to the country's history with the United States and the Cold War.

TITLE: China plans to begin training foreign astronauts for trips to newly completed orbiting space station
SUMMARY: China recently completed building the Tiangong Station, an orbitting space station. The country will soon begin training foreign astronauts for trips to the station.

TITLE: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko heading to Beijing for 3-day visit
SUMMARY: The president of Belarus is heading to Beijing as tensions rise over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. There has been growing concerns that China will provide military assistance to Russia

TITLE: Hong Kong to lift COVID mask mandate for both outside, inside areas on Wednesday
SUMMARY: Hong Kong plans to lift its coronavirus mask mandate by Wednesday. Residents will no longer need to mask when they’re outdoors and indoors, including in public transit.

TITLE: India revives civil militia after 7 Hindus were killed in disputed region of Kashmir
SUMMARY: The Indian government is rearming and training villagers to revive a civil militia after seven Hindus were killed in Kashmir, a disputed region between India and Pakistan.

TITLE: Philippines shifts focus to protecting territory as tensions between China and US increase
SUMMARY: The president of the Philippines said the military will shift its focus to protecting the country as tensions between the U.S. and China intensify.

TITLE: Protestant Council of Rwanda directs health facilities to stop carrying out all abortions
SUMMARY: The Protestant Council of Rwanda recently described abortion as a sin. The council has directed health facilities run by its members to stop carrying out abortions.

TITLE: Police scour Hong Kong landfill for slain model Abby Choi's missing body parts
SUMMARY: Roughly 100 Hong Kong police officers scoured a landfill looking for missing body parts of model Abby Choi whose legs and skull were found in her former father-in-law's home.

TITLE: Suspect poisons hundreds of schoolgirls in Iran, possibly to close classrooms for girls seeking an education
SUMMARY: Hundreds of Iranian schoolgirls across multiple schools were poisoned by fumes wafting into classrooms. Authorities believe the suspect wants to stop girls from seeking an education.

TITLE: German babysitter sentenced nearly 15 years for more than 100 child sex crimes: 'Unimaginable brutality'
SUMMARY: A 45-year-old German babysitter will spend nearly 15 years in prison for sexually abusing dozens of children over a 14-year-period with the youngest victim being a month old.

TITLE: British police launch major search for 2-month-old baby after officers arrest infant's parents
SUMMARY: British police recently arrested Aristocrat Constance Marten and Mark Gordon who have been on the run since January. The police are now looking for the couple's infant son.

TITLE: China’s Xi ‘in a panic’ over coming population crisis, will be ‘more provocative, more belligerent’: Chang
SUMMARY: Gordon Chang says Xi Jinping must be “in a panic” over China's demographic crisis and warns the leader could act "more provocative, more belligerent" as a result.

TITLE: Taliban using fingerprints, gun records to track down Afghans who assisted US, inspector general finds
SUMMARY: A new report from the Special Inspector General for Afghanistan Reconstruction says the Taliban are using fingerprints and gun records to track down people there who helped the U.S.

TITLE: Newly uncovered Mayan sculpture shows female ruler subduing captive male warrior
SUMMARY: A new statue of a female ruler subduing a male warrior was discovered at a Mayan ruin site in Mexico. The sculpture depicts the female grasping the captive man’s hair.

TITLE: Mexican army soldiers kill 5 unlikely armed victims, igniting a clash with angry residents
SUMMARY: Border residents of Nuevo Laredo clashed with the Mexican army Sunday, after soldiers killed five people that protestors believe were unarmed.

TITLE: NATO chief says Ukraine will 'become a member of our alliance' in the 'long term'
SUMMARY: NATO General Secretary Jens Stoltenberg indicated Tuesday it is a matter of when, not if, Ukraine will join the alliance and said member nations would continue to support Ukraine in its war against Russia.

TITLE: Putin orders increased border security after night of drone attacks as fighting in Ukraine intensifies
SUMMARY: Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered officials to tighten up border security after Russia saw several overnight drone attacks target oil depots.

TITLE: Ugandan lawmaker introduces legislation to prohibit homosexuality in the country
SUMMARY: Legislation to prohibit sexuality in Uganda was proposed by a lawmaker on Tuesday. The bill would punish "promotion, recruitment, and funding" of LGBTQ related activies.

TITLE: Anti-government protest held in Moldova's capitol, protestors chant 'down with the dictatorship!'
SUMMARY: A protest was held in Moldova's capitol on Tuesday. The protest was organized by an antigovernment group that is supported by members of the country's Russia-friendly Shor Party.

TITLE: Somalia drought 'extremely critical' but no famine projected
SUMMARY: Somalia's drought is being described as "extremely critical," but there is no famine projected. 3.8 million people have been displaced due to Somalia's battles with al-Shabab.

TITLE: Hospital in disputed Somaliland city shelled during upscale of violence, 1 dead
SUMMARY: A hospital in a disputed Somaliland city has been shelled during an upsurge of violence leaving one person dead. Allegedly the al-Shabab extremist group have supported the attacks.

TITLE: Sudanese security forces fatally shoot protester near capital
SUMMARY: Sudanese security forces fatally shot a protester in the chest near the country's capital on Tuesday. The man was participating in an anti-government protest.

TITLE: 9 historians recognized, awarded by Israeli university
SUMMARY: The Dan David Prize board has announced the nine historians receiving the award this year, each recognized for perceived 'outstanding contributions' to the field.

TITLE: ISIS-affiliated Moroccan jailed for beheading European hikers kills himself in prison
SUMMARY: A Moroccan convicted for being a member of an Islamic State-affiliated terror cell has killed himself in prison. The man was sentenced to death for beheading European hikers.

TITLE: Thai ambassador attends UK funeral of boy rescued from cave in 2018
SUMMARY: Thailand's ambassador to the U.K. visited the commonwealth for the funeral of Duangphet 'Dom' Phromthep, who in 2018 made global headlines when stranded in a cave with 11 other boys.

TITLE: Political tensions flare in Nigeria as early election results come in
SUMMARY: As Nigerian elections officials continue rolling out results, political tensions in Africa's most populated country are beginning to rise as multiple parties claim victory.

TITLE: Peruvian man found with 800-year-old mummy he called his 'spiritual girlfriend'
SUMMARY: A Peruvian man was stopped by police while carrying a 600 to 800 year old mummy around in a food delivery bag, according to the country's Ministry of Culture.

TITLE: US mainland under threat as Iran pushes assassinations, kidnappings: report
SUMMARY: A report from an NGO claims Iran is ostensibly expanding a list of assassination and terrorism targets in the US, according to highly detailed legal report viewed by Fox News Digital

TITLE: Fiery train crash in Greece leaves 36 dead, at least 85 injured
SUMMARY: A train collision in Greece on Tuesday left 36 people dead and at least another 85 injured. A passenger train collided at high speed with an oncoming freight train.

TITLE: Scientists debate whether moon should get its own time zone
SUMMARY: The European Space Agency will consider giving the moon its own time zone for accuracy in recording time considering nations from different time zones are planning lunar missions.

TITLE: We're No. 25: US slips again in annual global economic freedom index 'amid mounting deficit and debt burdens'
SUMMARY: The United States has slipped to 25th place globally for economic freedom amid excessive government spending and a mounting debt crisis, according to The Heritage Foundation.

TITLE: United States increasing assistance to Somalia in military offensive against al-Shabab
SUMMARY: Somalia's military is battling al-Shabab extremists that have captured dozens of communities since August. The United State has sent military assistance to help.

TITLE: Malaysia's prime minister claims over 200,000 refugees have fled to his country from Burma
SUMMARY: Over 200,000 Burma refugees have fled to Malaysia as a civil conflict continues in the nation. Other nations such as the Phillipines have discussed ending the conflict.

TITLE: Cyclone barrels through Vanuatu, causing trees to fall, power outages
SUMMARY: A cyclone barreled through Vanuatu knocking over trees. The residents lost power due to the powerful storm. Some residents even evacuated as rainfall flooded their homes.

TITLE: Norway's energy minister cancels UK trip as wind farm protests continue
SUMMARY: The energy minister of Norway had to cancel his trip to the United Kingdom due to protests against a wind farm. The activists have been blocking entrances to several ministries.

TITLE: Finland begins construction of Russia border fence
SUMMARY: Finland has begun construction on a border fence that will increase security along the eastern border with Russia in response to a rise in illegal immigration after Russia invaded Ukraine.

TITLE: Presidents of China, Belarus urge cease-fire, negotiations to settle Ukraine conflict
SUMMARY: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko visited China to meet with Xi Jinping on Wednesday. The two leaders urged a ceasefire and negotiations between Ukraine and Russia.

TITLE: Turkey's president says his government still intends to hold elections in May despite devastating earthquake
SUMMARY: Turkey's election is still set to be held on May 14, 2023, despite the recent earthquake. Hundreds of Turkey residents are homeless after the quake.

TITLE: Award-winning broadcaster Michèle Montas claims Haitians must be part of the answer to the country's violence
SUMMARY: Michèle Montas, a Haitian broadcaster from New York, claims Haitians should be part of the answer to the country's violence. She claims foreign aid efforts largely failed.

TITLE: Pakistan launches digital census in effort to gather demographic data before election
SUMMARY: A digital housing and population census was conducted in Pakistan on Wednesday. The census was meant to gather demographic data with the country's elections approaching.

TITLE: Report into Dutch protections of 3 murder victims finds security services didn't always act on threat tips
SUMMARY: A report found that Dutch security services don't always act on tips regarding potential threats. The report was investigating the protection of three murder victims.

TITLE: Germany presents new feminist foreign policy
SUMMARY: Germany’s foreign ministers presented a new feminist policy aimed at promoting female participation in decision-making. The policy aims to create more stable societies.

TITLE: United Nations condemns deployment of South Sudanese troops to disputed region of Abyei
SUMMARY: United Nations officials say the deployment of South Sudanese troops to the contested Abyei region will lead to "untold suffering and humanitarian concerns."

TITLE: 2 dead near Greece after overloaded migrant boat capsizes
SUMMARY: A couple of people drowned after an overloaded migrant boat carrying 27 people capsized off a Greek island. While most were rescued, one person remains missing.

TITLE: Polish prosecutors open investigation into hacked email account of aide to former PM Mateusz Morawiecki
SUMMARY: An investigation into emails from a hacked mailbox from an aide to former Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki has been opened. The aide resigned last year.

TITLE: Finland's Parliament gives final approval for country to join NATO with 184-7 vote
SUMMARY: Finland's Parliament voted 184 to seven in favor of the Nordic country to join NATO. Finland jointly applied to join NATO with Sweden last year.

TITLE: 22 people, including children, abducted by armed men in northern Congo
SUMMARY: Two dozen people, including kids, were kidnapped from three Congo villages by armed men dressed in white military uniforms. However, no one has claimed responsibilities for the crime.

TITLE: Connecticut man visiting Israel for wedding buried following terrorist attack
SUMMARY: Amid an intensified Palestinian wave of terrorism over the last few months, three terrorists are suspected of killing an American-Israeli citizen from Connecticut.

TITLE: Top Lebanese intelligence chief, mediator with Syria steps down
SUMMARY: Top Lebanese intelligence chief Maj. Gen. Abbas Ibrahim will be stepping down after attempts to extend his term failed. Ibrahim has mediated the release of Westerners held in Syria.

TITLE: Students stranded after hotel accidentally shreds 42 passports: report
SUMMARY: The lodge did not seem to provide an answer as to why it destroyed the dozens of passports left in its care by the traveling British students while on their ski trip.

TITLE: Italy stadium filled with coffins of migrants after shipwreck kills dozens
SUMMARY: Dozens of coffins filled a stadium in Italy after a ship carrying over a hundred people crashed off the coast, killing at least 67 people including children.

TITLE: China sends 25 warplanes, 3 ships sent toward Taiwan, island says
SUMMARY: Taiwan scrambled fighter jets and activated its missile defense systems on Wednesday morning after over two dozen Chinese warplanes were spotted approaching the island.

TITLE: Argentina suspends poultry exports after detecting 1st case of bird flu
SUMMARY: Poultry exports have halted in Argentina after the country detected its first case of bird flu in the industry. Most of its previous cases came from wild birds.

TITLE: Putin ally wants to increase jail time for those who insult Russian army, Wagner Group
SUMMARY: A lawmaker and ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin is pushing for harsher penalties of citizens who take issue with the country’s military.

TITLE: India sentences two pharma executives after cough syrup may have killed dozens of children in Gambia
SUMMARY: India has sentenced two pharmaceutical company executives after their cough syrups were linked to the deaths of dozens of children in Gambia.

TITLE: Lawyers calls for an investigation into alleged human right crimes committed by Turkey
SUMMARY: Human rights lawyers are calling for an investigation into Turkish authorities accused of committing crimes against thousands of opponents of President Erdogan.

TITLE: Iran president orders investigation into series of poison attacks at girls’ schools
SUMMARY: After hundreds of girls across 30 schools in Iran fell ill from poison attacks, the country’s president is ordering authorities to investigate the matter.

TITLE: Mexican president accuses chief justice of being soft on crime
SUMMARY: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador accused the chief justice of the nation's Supreme Court, Norma Piña, of promoting rulings favoring criminal suspects.

TITLE: Russia and China in unofficial arms race as US lags behind: experts
SUMMARY: Experts say Russia and China are now engaged in an unofficial arms race, with the U.S. falling behind, after Russia backed out of the New START treaty last month.

TITLE: US Army artillery officer dies during assignment in Thailand
SUMMARY: A U.S. Army artillery officer has died during an assignment in Thailand. The man took part in a major multinational military exercise. Officals said no foul play was suspected.

TITLE: Environmentalists, tuna fisheries clash over Indian Ocean temporary ban on driftnets
SUMMARY: The European bloc had opposed a resolution by the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission imposing a temporary ban on driftnets. Fisheries devices are used to catch 90% of tuna sold in the EU.

TITLE: Man suspected of cannibalism detained at airport after police found 'pieces of meat' in suitcase
SUMMARY: Begoleã Mendes Fernandes allegedly murdered Alan Lopes, 21, who had accepted Fernandes into his home, believing the man was homeless. Fernandes may have used a false name.

TITLE: China could funnel weapons to Russia through Belarus as defense ties with Beijing deepen: expert
SUMMARY: Russian President Putin's top allies, China and Belarus, met in Beijing to enhance relations as one security expert warns China could look to funnel arms to Russia through Belarus.

TITLE: British police find remains of baby after missing couple arrested
SUMMARY: British police have found the remains of a baby after a missing couple was arrested. The infant’s mother and her boyfriend had crisscrossed England to avoid authorities.

TITLE: Venezuelan mom of two dies after liposuction procedure at shopping center clinic
SUMMARY: A single mother from Venezuela with two children, died on Sunday after experiencing complications breathing following a liposuction procedure.

TITLE: New research shows where early humans survived in Ice Age-era Europe
SUMMARY: New research reveals that early humans who took refuge in modern-day Spain and Portugal were the only Europeans to survive the last Ice Age.

TITLE: US approves sale of F-16s munitions, other military equipment to Taiwan
SUMMARY: The Pentagon has approved the potential $619 million sale of F-16 munitions and related equipment to Taiwan amid heightened tensions with Beijing.

TITLE: Dad slapped with fine after family stays too long at McDonald’s Playland parking lot: reports
SUMMARY: A British man is fighting a fine he received in the mail after his wife and kids went to a McDonald's restaurant and exceeded the parking lot time limit by 10 minutes.

TITLE: NATO member urges allies to pay more after Ukraine war anniversary, claims 'crisis' in UN
SUMMARY: Estonia recently announced that it intends to push for NATO spending to increase to 2.5% of GDP, saying that the current requirement is not enough for effective defense.

TITLE: Indian man extradited to Australia, charged with killing a dog walker in 2018
SUMMARY: An Indian national has been extradited to Australia on murder charges. The 38-year-old man is accused of killing a 24-year-old as she walked her dog in 2018.

TITLE: 26,000 people evacuated as floods hit Malaysia
SUMMARY: Malaysian rescue teams are hauling people to safety as Malaysia gets hit by floodwaters. Over 26,000 people were evacuated and at least one person has died.

TITLE: Denmark's famous Little Mermaid statue vandalized with colors of the Russian flag
SUMMARY: A 5.4-foot-high bronze statue of the Little Mermaid in Denmark was vandalized with the colors of the Russian flag. It is not known when the vandalism took place.

TITLE: Albania's prime minister denies that he had bribed, given preferential treatment to indicted FBI agent
SUMMARY: Edi Rama, the prime minister of Albania, denies bribing or giving preferential treatment to Charles McGonigal. McGonigal is a former FBI agent who was indicted by the United States.

TITLE: US naval forces help UK seize 'anti-tank guided missiles' from Iran
SUMMARY: The U.S. Naval Forces Central Command says American forces have teamed up with U.K. maritime forces to seize an “illegal weapons shipment” that originated from Iran.

TITLE: French senators set to begin debating President Macron's pension plan which aims to raise the retirement age
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron's pension plan aims to raise the country's retirement age from 62 to 64. French senators are set to debate the contested pension plan on Thursday.

TITLE: Italy prime minister urges India to play central role in ending Russia, Ukraine war
SUMMARY: The Italian Prime Minister is pressuring India to help end the war between Russia and Ukraine. So far, India, a Russian ally since the Cold War-era, has not criticized Russia.

TITLE: Forest protection summit underway in Gabon, some countries believe protecting forests needs to be profitable
SUMMARY: Gabon is hosting a summit on how to protect major forests across the world. The major issue being discussed is who will pay to protect the world's major forests.

TITLE: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is calling on China to refrain from sending weapons to Russia
SUMMARY: Olaf Scholz is asking China to refrain from sending weapons to Russia. He believes China should use its influence to press Russia to withdraw troops from Ukraine.

TITLE: G20 run-in: Blinken sees Russia’s Lavrov in India for first time since Putin’s invasion of Ukraine
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken ran into his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov on the sidelines of the G20 summit in their first in-person encounter since President Putin launched his invasion on Ukraine.

TITLE: Pakistan frees retired army general accused of inciting violence against national institutions
SUMMARY: Pakistan has freed retired Gen. Shoaib, a critic of the current prime minister, who was arrested for inciting the public against national institutions.

TITLE: 20 injured by turbulence while flying from Germany to Mauritius
SUMMARY: Two dozen people became injured after their aircraft was hit by turbulence. Their flight departed from Frankfurt, Germany, and was scheduled to land in Mauritius.

TITLE: Egypt discovers 30-foot-long chamber inside Great Pyramid of Giza
SUMMARY: A 30-foot-long chamber has been discovered inside Egypt’s Great Pyramid of Giza. However, the function of the chamber is still unknown.

TITLE: Cult leader who claimed to ‘channel spirits’ of Jesus, Trump and Freddie Mercury dies
SUMMARY: Ryuho Okawa claimed he could channel the spirits of any person, living or dead, and he published his revelations and conversations in books that he sold worldwide.

TITLE: North Korea to expand state control of farming amid worsening food shortage
SUMMARY: The North Korean government plans to take tighter control of its agricultural sector in order to overcome an ongoing food shortage, according to state media.

TITLE: G-20 run-in: Blinken sees Russia’s Lavrov in India for first time since Putin’s invasion of Ukraine
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken ran into his Russian counterpart Sergei Lavrov on the sidelines of the G-20 summit in their first in-person encounter since President Putin launched his invasion on Ukraine.

TITLE: Kenya's president criticizes Supreme Court ruling allowing activist to register an LGBTQ rights organization
SUMMARY: A recent Supreme Court ruling allowed an activist to register an LGBTQ rights organization in Kenya. Kenya's president criticized the ruling.

TITLE: European Union officials set up scheme to speed up delivery of howitzer artillery rounds to Ukraine
SUMMARY: EU officials are looking for a way to speed up the delivery of howitzer artillery rounds to Ukraine. They are also discussing dedicating an extra billion euros to help the country.

TITLE: Norwegian police remove Sami indigenous rights activists from entrances to government buildings
SUMMARY: Police removed Sami indigenous rights protestors from the entrances of buildings in Norway during protests. The activists were blocking government building entrances

TITLE: Elderly man kills teen neighbor over noise complaints: German police
SUMMARY: The Italian neighbor, identified as Guiseppe Del B., had reportedly complained many times about noise from his neighbors, which led to him shooting the teen.

TITLE: African World Health Organization official urges for more support to countries facing cholera outbreaks
SUMMARY: A WHO official claims cholera has the potential to explode as rainfall persists in Africa. The official is urging more support to countries that are suffering from outbreaks.

TITLE: Greek transportation minister resigns, station manager arrested after head-on train crash kills 57
SUMMARY: A train station manager is facing charges in Greece and a transportation chief has resigned following a deadly head-on collision between a passenger and freight train.

TITLE: Netanyahu rips 'anarchists' who staged mass protest outside salon with wife inside
SUMMARY: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemned protesters for harassing his wife as she went to a hair salon in Tel Aviv on Wednesday, leading to a police standoff.

TITLE: 42 Spanish families pursuing legal action against nurse who allegedly faked the vaccine process for children
SUMMARY: A nurse in Spain allegedly faked the process of administering vaccines to children. Forty-two Spanish families are pursuing legal actions against the nurse.

TITLE: Buenos Aires plunges into darkness after energy grid fire causes massive blackout
SUMMARY: Massive regions of Argentina are experiencing blackouts after a grid was on fire. Residents are left without power as they endure a major heat wave in the country.

TITLE: Former Italy PM investigated for allegedly mishandling COVID outbreak
SUMMARY: Italy’s former Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is being placed under investigation. He is accused of mishandling the coronavirus pandemic that broke out in 2020.

TITLE: MI5 failed in Ariana Grande concert bombing that killed 22 inquiry finds
SUMMARY: The U.K.'s top intelligence agency MI5 failed to respond to key information that could have stopped the 2017 suicide bombing at an Ariana Grande concert in Manchester that killed 22 people.

TITLE: Kandinsky painting that spent decades in Dutch museum sells at auction for $44.9 million
SUMMARY: A Kandinsky painting called "Murnau with Church II“ sold for $44.9 million in London. The painting has been at a Dutch museum for decades after the owner was killed in the Holocaust.

TITLE: Massive Hong Kong fire consumes skyscraper under construction, raining burning embers rain onto street
SUMMARY: A massive fire broke out after midnight at a skyscraper in Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, raining embers and smoke down into the urban area as firefighters fought the blaze.

TITLE: Police say 3 foreign skiers were killed in Canadian avalanche
SUMMARY: An avalanche in southeastern British Columbia killed three foreign skiers Wednesday near the Panorama Mountain Resort. Four others were inured but are expected to recover.

TITLE: Mystery 30-foot chamber found inside Egypt's Great Pyramid
SUMMARY: Egyptian officials revealed the discovery of a mysterious, 30-foot-long corridor sealed off inside the Pyramid of Khufu on Thursday. It was discovered using modern scanning.

TITLE: Residents evacuated, neighboring buildings consumed by Hong Kong skyscraper fire
SUMMARY: Neighboring buildings were evacuated as a fire razed a skyscraper under construction in Hong Kong's densely populated Tsim Sha Tsui shopping district.

TITLE: Italy closes investigation alleging COVID lockdown failures
SUMMARY: Italy prosecutors closed an investigation alleging COVID lockdown failures in the early days of lockdown. The case will now go to a magistrate to decide whether to indict more suspects.

TITLE: Massive Hong Kong fire consumes skyscraper under construction, raining burning embers onto street
SUMMARY: A massive fire broke out early Friday at a skyscraper in Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, raining embers and smoke down into the urban area as firefighters fought the blaze.

TITLE: Guinea, Ivory Coast repatriating citizens from Tunisia after migrant crackdown
SUMMARY: The nations of Guinea and Ivory Coast are repatriating citizens from Tunisia who want to leave after a migrant crackdown. Tunisian president called for urgent measures on illegal immigration.

TITLE: Scientists discover new Easter Island moai statue in dry lake bed
SUMMARY: Scientists have found a previously undiscovered moai, monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people on Easter Island, in a dry lake bed.

TITLE: Israeli forces fatally shoot teenager amid West Bank violence
SUMMARY: Israeli forces in the West Bank fatally shot a teenager in the back as he threw stones at Israeli troops who entered the village. This attack was a part of the violence raging for months.

TITLE: Brazil allows Iranian warships to dock in Rio de Janeiro, worrying international officials
SUMMARY: Two Iranian warships have docked in Rio de Janeiro with the consent of Brazil's socialist government, drawing concern and sharp criticism from Western officials.

TITLE: Blinken says US put forward ‘serious proposal’ to secure ex-Marine Paul Whelan’s release from Russia
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says the U.S. has put forward a proposal to Moscow for the release of former U.S. Marine Paul Whelan.

TITLE: Bodies from Greece train collision that killed 57 returned to families in closed caskets
SUMMARY: The bodies from Tuesday's train crash in Greece are being returned to families in closed caskets. The collision was the deadliest rail accident in the country’s history.

TITLE: Climate protestors gather across Germany to demand tougher government action against global warming
SUMMARY: Protestors across Germany gathered to demand the government take action against global warming. The protestors in Germany are part of a global "climate strike."

TITLE: Germany wants to buy mothballed Leopard 2 battle tanks to replace those being sent to Ukraine
SUMMARY: After sending Leopard two tanks to Ukraine, Germany wants to buy mothballed Leopard 2 battle tanks from Switzerland. Germany assured it would not send the new tanks to Ukraine.

TITLE: Colombia proposes transferring 70 hippos that live near Pablo Escobar's former ranch to India, Mexico
SUMMARY: Pablo Escobar imported four hippos to his ranch in the 1980s. Colombia has proposed transferring at least 70 hippos that live near Escobar's ranch to India and Mexico.

TITLE: Explosion, fire near illegal oil refinery in Nigeria kills at least 12 people
SUMMARY: An illegal oil refinery explosion in Nigeria killed at least 12 people. Local residents claim the death toll is higher. Most victims were young people who planned to siphon oil.

TITLE: Japanese residents who claim to have suffered decades of human rights abuses in North Korea seek compensation
SUMMARY: Japanese residents were lured to North Korea by false promises of "Paradise on Earth" decades ago. The residents are seeking compensation from North Korea.

SUMMARY: Farmers in Belgium drove their tractors to Brussels to protest a plan to cut nitrate levels. More than 2,700 farm vehicles converged in the European city.

TITLE: Nicaragua president executes 40 people, orders hospitals to not treat protestors, UN says
SUMMARY: Nicaragua President Daniel Ortega has committed crimes against humanity, according to a United Nations human rights group. A report claims that Ortega executed 40 people.

TITLE: Israeli army stops liberal Israelis from staging solidarity rally for Palestinian town
SUMMARY: Israeli troops blocked hundreds of left-wing Israelis from staging a rally in support of the West Bank town of Hawara, which was set on fire by radical Jews Sunday.

TITLE: Texas college student fights Russian troops in Ukraine
SUMMARY: A Columbia University student has gone to Ukraine four times to fight alongside Ukrainian troops facing Russian forces. She says she is dedicated to help the country defend democracy and defeat Vladimir Putin.

SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov exchanged barbs one day after their first in-person run-in at the G-20 summit in India.

TITLE: Brother of Singapore PM accuses government of persecuting his family
SUMMARY: The brother of Singapore’s prime minister said the country is persecuting his family. The family was put under official investigation regarding the will of the brothers’ late father.

TITLE: Grenade explosion at courthouse in Montenegro kills 1, injures 5
SUMMARY: A grenade explosion at a courthouse in Montenegro's capital injured five people. The man who tried to detonate the grenade died in the explosion.

TITLE: US, South Korea to hold biggest joint field exercises in 5 years
SUMMARY: The U.S. and South Korea will hold its biggest joint field trainings in the last five years. However, North Korea may take strong action against such exercises.

TITLE: King Charles III plans to travel to France, Germany for first state visits since becoming monarch
SUMMARY: King Charles III of England planned his first state visits since becoming a monarch. The king will travel to Germany and France from March 26 to March 31.

TITLE: Belarusian Nobel Peace Prize winner sentenced to 10 years in prison for financing anti-government protests
SUMMARY: Ales Bialiatski, a Belarusian human rights activist, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for financing protests that were against the country's government.

TITLE: Hong Kong skyscraper fire could mean $64M payout, cause under investigation
SUMMARY: The property developers responsible for the nearly-completed Kimpton Hotel may be in for a historic insurance payout after the project was consumed in flames Friday.

TITLE: Bodies exhumed from makeshift graves in Ukrainian towns once occupied by Russian troops
SUMMARY: Nearly a year after Ukraine retook towns near Kyiv from Russian troops, authorities are still digging up bodies of victims that were hastily buried in makeshift graves.

TITLE: 'Blade Runner' Oscar Pistorius may see early release after upcoming parole meeting: report
SUMMARY: The lawyer for the family of Oscar Pistorius's murdered girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp, said that he is entitled to his parole as a matter of process, and that the law "must take its course."

SUMMARY: While conducting a hate speech probe, authorities in Germany were able to seize weapons including a crossbow and grenades from a suspected anti-government extremist’s home.

TITLE: UK couple to remain in custody after authorities find remains of an infant inside a nearby garden shed
SUMMARY: A couple charged with gross negligence manslaughter will remain in custody in England. The body of an infant was found inside a plastic bag inside a garden shed.

TITLE: Oil protests turn deadly as 79 police taken hostage, 2 people killed
SUMMARY: Protests in Colombia have taken a violent turn after residents took 79 police officers hostage and two people died in the clash.

TITLE: China conducts secretive space walk ignoring international norms: 'contempt for transparency'
SUMMARY: China this week revealed that two of its astronauts had conducted a second space walk in an undisclosed operation on the Tiangong space station.

TITLE: 17 dead in Indonesia fuel depot fire
SUMMARY: A fire at the Plumpang fuel storage station in Jakarta, Indonesia, has killed at least 17 people and led to the evacuation of thousands of others in the area.

TITLE: Serbia denies providing weapons to Ukraine
SUMMARY: Serbian Foreign Minister Ivica Dacic on Thursday categorically denied allegations that the Balkan state was providing Ukrainian forces with weapons.

TITLE: Belgian woman who murdered her 5 kids euthanized 16 years later to the day
SUMMARY: A 56-year-old woman in Belgium chose to be euthanized this week, exactly 16 years after she slit her five young children's throats at their home.

TITLE: Mexico wants Arizona rancher's murder charge upgraded after migrant shooting
SUMMARY: Mexico wants Arizona prosecutors to charge a man accused of killing a migrant on his property with first-degree murder.

SUMMARY: Researchers observing wild dogs near Ukraine's Chernobyl disaster site hope to extrapolate survival possibilities for humans under similar conditions from the dogs' behavior.

SUMMARY: Japan has grappled with its declining birth rate for almost a decade, culminating in the lowest on record since the country started keeping records in 1899.

SUMMARY: Panama's Supreme Court ruled that the ability to enter into a same-sex marriage is not a "fundamental right" as gay rights supporters claim they are invisible in the country.

TITLE: Climate activists deface constitutional monument in Germany with black paint, posters
SUMMARY: Members of climate activist group The Last Generation defaced artwork outside the German Parliament on Saturday, splashing it with a dark liquid resembling oil.

SUMMARY: A bus with forty elementary school students plunged down a wooded slope in the French Alps leaving over a dozen children with injuries.

SUMMARY: The caste system is a key decider of status in India, and is relevant enough in Indian-American communities for cities like Seattle to try banning caste discrimination.

TITLE: UK PM Sunak vows to deport all illegal immigrants: ‘You will not be able to stay’
SUMMARY: The United Kingdom will begin deporting every illegal immigrant crossing its borders and will not allow them to apply for asylum, Prime Minister Rishi Sunak says.

TITLE: China boosts military spending by billions as US warns of potential Taiwan invasion
SUMMARY: The Chinese government increased its military spending in 2023, infusing nearly $16 billion to bring the budget to $230 billion as the U.S. warns of a Taiwan invasion.

TITLE: Greek PM apologizes to families of 57 killed in head-on train collision as protests unfold
SUMMARY: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Sunday asked for forgiveness from the families of the 57 victims who died after two trains collided head-on last week.

SUMMARY: Intelligence officials warn that Russia and Iran hammered out secret deals to benefit Tehran’s accumulation of uranium for its nuclear weapons program that would defeat the purpose of a renegotiated deal between the U.S. and Iran.

SUMMARY: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu responded to Israeli Minister Bezalel Smotrich's earlier comments about wiping out a Palestinian town, calling them "inappropriate."

TITLE: Cancun taxi drivers throw wrench in spring break plans as Americans flock to Mexican destination
SUMMARY: As millions of Americans prepare to travel to Mexico's top tourist destinations for spring break, travelers may need to prepare for ground travel as tensions rise between cabbies and Uber drivers.

TITLE: German chancellor doubles down, warns of 'consequences' if China sends arms to Russia
SUMMARY: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz warned of 'consequences' should China move forward with sending arms and ammunition to assist Moscow in the ongoing Ukraine-Russia War.

TITLE: Four Americans who traveled into Matamoros, Mexico are missing in possible kidnapping: FBI
SUMMARY: The Federal Bureau of Investigations said four Americans who traveled from Texas to Tamaulipas, Mexico are now missing after they were shot at and possibly kidnaped.

TITLE: 4 Americans who traveled into Matamoros, Mexico, missing in possible kidnapping: FBI
SUMMARY: The Federal Bureau of Investigations said four Americans who traveled from Texas to Tamaulipas, Mexico, are missing after they were shot at and possibly kidnapped.

TITLE: Refugee camp fire in Bangladesh leaves thousands of Muslims from Myanmar homeless
SUMMARY: A fire at a refugee camp in Bangladesh has left thousands of Rohingya Muslims homeless. Hundreds of thousands of Muslims escaped Myanmar during a brutal crackdown.

TITLE: Suicide bomber in Pakistan kills 10 policemen, injures 12 others
SUMMARY: At least 10 policemen were killed when a suicide bomber riding a motorcycle targeted a police truck in Pakistan. No one has claimed responsibility for the attack yet.

SUMMARY: A female “Voladores” performer fatally fell from a 30-yard-high pole in Puebla, Mexico, on Saturday. The rest of the festivities have been cancelled.

SUMMARY: A fire that broke out in an apartment in Serbia killed four kids and injured their parents. All of the children died from carbon monoxide poisoning.

SUMMARY: Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei called for "capital punishment" for those responsible for poisoning hundreds of schoolgirls if the acts were deliberate.

SUMMARY: Christian and minority lawmakers in Iraq are pushing back on a 2016 alcohol ban that has officially gone into effect, arguing it discriminates against non-Muslims communities.

TITLE: Archaeologists in Egypt unearth Sphinx-like Roman-era statue
SUMMARY: A Sphinx-like statue from the Roman empire has been unearthed in Egypt. Archaeologists also discovered the remains of a shrine in an ancient temple.

TITLE: 17 bodies recovered after Burmese army said to rape, behead, and kill in several villages
SUMMARY: Burmese soldiers rampaged through villages and killed at least 17 people. They have also beheaded, tortured, and raped residents in a series of war crimes since the army took control.

TITLE: Ashes of Thailand boy rescued from flooded cave released on Mekong River
SUMMARY: Duangphet Phromthep who was rescued from a flooded cave in Thailand died at age 17 last month while attending a sports academy in England. His ashes were released on Mekong River.

SUMMARY: The four American citizens who were kidnapped in Mexico may have been the victims of mistaken identity, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador said Monday.

TITLE: Paris’ Notre Dame Cathedral set to reopen in December 2024
SUMMARY: The Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, France, is scheduled to reopen in December 2024, less than six years after the roof was ravaged by a fire in 2019.

TITLE: China dismisses American concerns about 'spy cranes' as 'paranoia'

TITLE: Spain asks US to clean up site of 1966 nuclear accident
SUMMARY: Spain is asking the U.S. to clean up a nuclear site where a U.S. bomber and a refueling plane crashed mid-air and dropped four hydrogen bombs above southern Spain.

TITLE: Sultan al-Jaber, COP28 president, calls for climate action
SUMMARY: Sultan al-Jaber, who is the president of COP28, is calling for climate action. The CEO of the Abu Dhabi National Oil Co. will lead international climate talks later this year.

SUMMARY: Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin said the fall of Bakhmut to Russian forces would not mean Moscow had gained a strategic advantage in Ukraine.

TITLE: Russia claims to have ended ethnic tensions in Nagorno-Karabakh, urges restraint
SUMMARY: Russia forces helped end a deadly weekend shootout along an auxiliary dirt road that links Armenia with Nagorno-Karabak. Officials checked vehicles suspected of transporting weapons.

TITLE: Sudanese activists acquitted in intel agent's killing

TITLE: Russia sends fertilizer to Malawi, aims to garner African support
SUMMARY: The Russian government has donated 20,000 tons of fertilizer to Malawi as part of a broader effort to garner African support while strained for alliances in the West.

TITLE: Turkish opposition leaders nominate Erdogan challenger
SUMMARY: A six-party alliance nominated opposition leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu to take on incumbent Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in May's consequential election.

TITLE: 4 Peruvian soldiers drown in river while responding to protests
SUMMARY: Four Peruvian soldiers have drowned in a river while responding to protests demanding the resignation of Peru’s president. The soldiers tried to cross a bridge, but it was blocked.

TITLE: US seeks consultation with Mexico over GMO corn restrictions
SUMMARY: The U.S. Trade Representative's Office announced a call for consultation with Mexican officials over the nation's proposed ban on consumption of genetically modified corn.

TITLE: London police seeking group of men who tortured foxes, set them on fire
SUMMARY: British police are investigating reports of a group of men regularly torturing foxes -- including setting them on fire -- in a wooded area.

TITLE: First of four Americans kidnapped in Mexico has been identified
SUMMARY: A family member has identified one of the U.S. citizens that was fired upon and kidnapped by drug cartel faction members after they traveled into Mexico for health services.

TITLE: North Korea threatens action after US flies nuclear-capable B-52 bomber over Korean Peninsula
SUMMARY: Kim Yo Jong, the sister of North Korean dictator Kim Jong-Un, sharply criticized the US and South Korea for flying a nuclear-capable bomber during a joint military exercise.

TITLE: Xi accuses US of 'suppression,' 'containment' of China
SUMMARY: President Xi Jinping accused the U.S. and "Western countries" of attempting to contain and suppress the Chinese economy at a press conference on Monday.

TITLE: US citizen, Somali convicted of helping pirates kidnap journalist
SUMMARY: Two people helped Somali pirates abduct a German-American journalist in 2012 for a $1.6 million ransom. They were convicted of hostage-taking and supporting acts of terrorism.

TITLE: Canada’s Trudeau opens investigation into China election meddling
SUMMARY: Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Monday that he would open an investigation into whether China interfered in Canada's 2021 and 2019 elections following reports that suggested as much.

TITLE: Two of the four Americans kidnapped in Mexico are dead, two alive: report
SUMMARY: Two American citizens who were kidnapped shortly after crossing into Mexico have died, while the two other are still alive, according to the governor of Tamaulipas.

TITLE: Biden claims NATO is a 'sacred commitment,' but do other countries feel the same?
SUMMARY: While the U.S. contributes over two-thirds of NATO nations' defense sending, others not meeting the 2% goal could be looking to "hold America's coat" amid conflict.

SUMMARY: South Korean intelligence agencies have announced that officials believe the mysterious first-born child of North Korean dictator Kim Jong Un is a male.

TITLE: Bangladesh building explosion kills 14 people, injures dozens
SUMMARY: A seven-story commercial building was heavily damaged when an explosion occurred Tuesday. At least 14 people were killed and 50 people were taken to the hospital for treatment.

TITLE: 2 pilots killed after Italian Air Force planes crash mid-air
SUMMARY: Two Italian Air Force planes collided during an exercise northeast of Rome, Italy. Both pilots were killed in the crash but no injuries on the ground were reported.

TITLE: Argentina police arrest suspect who killed 11-year-old boy during a birthday party
SUMMARY: A suspected Argentinian gunman who killed an 11-year-old boy during a birthday party has been arrested. Neighbors of the alleged shooter later attacked and burned his home.

TITLE: Four Americans kidnapped in Mexico: What we know
SUMMARY: Four Americans were traveling to Mexico for a medical procedure when their van was ambushed by suspected members of a Mexican cartel, with the Americans being kidnapped.

SUMMARY: 2 Italian Air Force planes fatally collided mid-air on Tuesday during an exercise, and crashed to the ground. Both of the U-208 aircrafts crashed near Guidonia military airport.

SUMMARY: Argentina's president has boosted security forces in the violence-plagued city of Rosario. The city has seen the death of an 11-year-old and a threat against soccer star Lionel Messi.

TITLE: St. John Paul II knew that priests under his authority were sexually abusing children, Polish report alleges
SUMMARY: St. John Paul II allegedly knew that the priests under his authority while he was an archbishop in Poland were sexually abusing minors, a Polish channel reported.

TITLE: Roman shrine unearthed beneath former graveyard of a cathedral in England

SUMMARY: Another person has been arrested in Hong Kong model Abby Choi’s gruesome killing. At total of seven suspects have been arrested including her ex-husband and his family members.

TITLE: Two Americans who survived Mexico kidnapping are back in US, transported to Texas hospital

TITLE: Northern Egypt train derailment kills 2, injures 16
SUMMARY: A train derailment in northern Egypt killed two people and injured 16 others. Train derailments are common in Egypt due to poor maintenance; however crash in question attributed to driver error.

TITLE: EU imposes sanctions on 9 Taliban, Russian officers over women's rights abuses
SUMMARY: The European Union has imposed sanctions on nine Taliban and Russian officers over women's rights abuses. The EU has accused them all of sexual abuse of women and rights violations.

TITLE: Reformist Sudanese general says military leaders refuse to step down
SUMMARY: Sudanese Gen. Mohammed Hamdan Dagalo claims that ruling generals in the African nation refuse to step down and allow for a democratic transition to civilian government.

SUMMARY: Georgians are protesting against a draft law on media and nonprofits which they view as stifling to freedom of the press. Authorities have employed tear gas and water cannons against the protesters.

TITLE: Two Americans who survived Mexico kidnapping are back in US, taken to Texas hospital
SUMMARY: Two surviving victims of a kidnapping in Mexico were taken to the United States and are receiving treatment at a hospital in Texas, the State Department said.

SUMMARY: The United Nations has restored voting rights for Lebanon, Gabon and South Sudan while foregoing those of Venezuela over outstanding debts.

SUMMARY: A Canadian woman was found dead at a Mexican resort only one day after she arrived with her boyfriend for vacation in Playa del Carmen

SUMMARY: One of the Americans kidnapped during an ambush by a Mexican drug cartel last week was reportedly able to talk to her mother from a Texas hospital on Tuesday.

SUMMARY: U.S. officials speaking on anonymity said covid-19 restrictions on travelers coming from China to the U.S. will be relaxed by the end of the week.

SUMMARY: Nearly 10 years after flight MH370 disappeared en route to China, the families of the missing passengers have started to push for a renewed search effort using modern technology.

SUMMARY: Mexican officials have arrested a man in the kidnapping and murders of four U.S. citizens. He is the only person arrested so far in connection with the case.

SUMMARY: A deadly Mexico kidnapping revealed this week the dangers Americans face in their pursuit of health care abroad as medical tourism continues to escalate.

TITLE: International Women's Day: Female activists that have made an impact around the world
SUMMARY: In honor of International Women's Day, here are some of the most recognizable and powerful female advocates for human and gender rights over the last decade to.

SUMMARY: The United Nations said Afghanistan is the most repressive country for women’s rights in the world, citing their methodical efforts to restrict their education.

TITLE: Brussels diamond heist looking like a perfect crime nearly a decade after last 4 suspects acquitted
SUMMARY: Only one person has been convicted in connection with a diamond heist at a Brussels airport, 22 others have been acquitted. The heist took place almost a decade ago.

SUMMARY: Authorities in the Henan province of the People's Republic of China are requiring religious residents to register with their "Smart Religion" app in order to worship.

SUMMARY: A suspected drone strike in Syria killed at least three people. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack. Reports about what actually happened are mixed.

SUMMARY: Taiwan suspects that Chinese ships cut the internet cables that fed into its outlying islands after some residents reported that they haven’t had internet for the past month.

SUMMARY: For the first time in over two decades, women have enlisted in Colombia's army. The country's army wants to "strengthen the role of women" in it's ranks.

SUMMARY: Rep. Cory Mills placed much of the blame for America's chaotic final days in Afghanistan on President Biden, saying responsibility falls on the commander in chief.

SUMMARY: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said Ukraine's Bakhmut may fall to Russia "in the coming days" but did not confirm Russian claims that it has taken the eastern part of the city.

SUMMARY: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is facing her first crisis after taking office in October, after a migrant-packed vessel broke into pieces just off the shore of Italy.

SUMMARY: Two dozen supporters of former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Kahn were arrested for defying a government rally ban. Police used water cannons and tear gas to break up the rallies.

SUMMARY: Nazanin Boniadi, a famous actress from Iran, is urging the world to back protestors calling for women's rights and political change in Iran.

SUMMARY: Olena Zelenska, the first lady of Ukraine, visited the United Arab Emirates on Wednesday. She spoke before a packed ballroom on International Women's Day.

SUMMARY: Thousands of Iranian students have been poisoned across the country. A United Nations cultural agency has expressed concern about the poisonings.

SUMMARY: Families of the two surviving Americans identified them during interviews with local news outlets, detailing the relief they felt and the horror their loved ones experienced.

SUMMARY: A mortar shell misfired during an army training session in India. The shell fell short of its target and killed three people in a nearby village instead.

SUMMARY: The investigation in Puerto Rico’s lone zoo where various animals died has been dropped. The remaining animals will be transferred to sanctuaries in the U.S. mainland.

SUMMARY: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva announced Wednesday that his administration would seek to promote spending on women's healthcare and other gender-specific interests.

TITLE: Aid group briefly shuts down hospital in Haiti amid spike in gang violence
SUMMARY: Doctors Without Borders was forced to briefly shut down a hospital in Haiti amid a spike in violence. Another nearby hospital said they have seen a tenfold increase in gunshot wounds.

SUMMARY: Security forces fired tear gas canisters and flash grenades at mourners of Hamas militant Abdul Fattah Kharushah after they began protesting the Palestinian Authority.

SUMMARY: Experts told Fox News Digital about the decades-long mission China has pursued to obtain comparable air force capabilities to the U.S. by using espionage to copy what they can.

SUMMARY: The Ukrainian Defense Ministry announced a major Russian missile attack took place early Thursday morning, damaging cities across the country including Kyiv.

SUMMARY: A Mexican official said on Friday that five suspects had been arrested in connection the deadly cartel kidnappings of four Americans.

SUMMARY: Ukraine was the third largest importer of arms in 2022 thanks to aid from the United States and Europe. Ukraine imported few major arms until the end of 2021.
