TITLE: Japanese residents continue to wear masks after 3-year-long request ends
SUMMARY: Japan has dropped its three-year-long masking request in one of its last steps in easing COVID rules in public places. However, nothing has changed as residents continue to wear them.

TITLE: Nepal's newly elected president takes oath in Kathmandu
SUMMARY: Ram Chandra Poudel, the newly elected president of Nepal, took his oath of office in Kathmandu on Monday. He is the third president since the country abolished its monarchy.

TITLE: 19 people slaughtered in eastern Congo by Islamic State-related extremists
SUMMARY: Almost two dozen people in eastern Congo were slaughtered with guns, machetes, and knives by a militia with ties to the Islamic State group.

TITLE: Italy estimates 680K migrants in Libya want to cross Mediterranean Sea for Europe
SUMMARY: An Italian report suggests that nearly 700,000 people are waiting for an opportunity to migrate from Libya to Europe. However, a U.N. official has challenged the report’s credibility.

TITLE: Nursery school under fire for advising parents to not call daughters 'pretty' or 'princess': 'Daft advice'
SUMMARY: Parents in the United Kingdom are speaking out about a handbook from nursery school provider Bright Horizons that advises they not call their daughters "princess" or "pretty."

TITLE: Thousands of junior doctors go on strike across England to demand better pay
SUMMARY: Junior doctors across England are demanding better pay with a three-day strike. Junior doctors in the country make up 45% of all doctors in the National Health Service.

TITLE: UN commission claims international community, Syrian government didn't react to earthquake quickly enough
SUMMARY: A United Nations commission claims Syria's government and the international community didn't act quickly following the earthquake that hit Turkey and Syria.

TITLE: Former Haiti mayor accused of torturing, killing his political opponents heads to court in Boston
SUMMARY: Former Haiti mayor Jean Morose Viliena is accused of violently terrorizing his political opponents. He will head to trial in Boston, Massachusetts, where he now lives.

TITLE: Xi Jinping to speak with Zelenskyy after meeting Putin in Moscow: report
SUMMARY: Ukraine's Zelenskyy may speak next week with Chinese President Xi Jinping for the first time since the Russian invasion, following Xi's meeting with Vladimir Putin in Moscow.

TITLE: Activists blame Italy's slow response time for death of 30 migrants off Libya coast
SUMMARY: A group of activists is blaming Italy's failure to offer timely assistance for the death of 30 migrants off of Libya. 17 others survived the deadly shipwreck.

TITLE: Saudi Arabia executes man for drug charges, family says he was tortured into confessing
SUMMARY: A man executed by Saudi Arabia for drug charges was tortured into confessing, his family said.

TITLE: 16 people killed in Nigeria by men armed with guns and machetes, government says
SUMMARY: Men returned with guns and machetes after a fight broke out in northwest Nigeria. The gunmen killed at least 16 people, the government said.

TITLE: UN head calls for scientist to serve 'cold, hard facts' that will push governments to curb climate change
SUMMARY: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres asked scientists to serve facts which will push governments to make policies aimed at combatting climate change,

TITLE: Wild sex claims revealed at 'cushiest' prison as 18 female guards fired, quit: report
SUMMARY: At least 18 female prison guards in the United Kingdom have been fired or resigned over allegations of having intimate relationships with male inmates, a report found.

TITLE: Poland revamping military, more than doubling its army to counter Russian threat: report
SUMMARY: Wary of Russia's larger territorial ambitions, Poland has been steadily modernizing its military by boosting its manpower and ordering new equipment from allies.

TITLE: 2 foreign tourists die in Kenya nature reserve crash
SUMMARY: Two foreign tourists died after their vehicle veered off the road and overturned in Kenya's Maasai Mara nature reserve. One German and one Swiss national died.

TITLE: France's Macron under pressure as pension reform blowback reaches peak
SUMMARY: French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to face one of the most difficult weeks of his presidency amid sociopolitical unrest over his plan to raise the country's retirement age.

TITLE: Bill concentrating power in Netanyahu coalition advances, Israeli legal reform proceeds
SUMMARY: Allies of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Israel's Knesset have introduced a bill insulating the leader from potential legal challenges over corruption charges.

TITLE: Mexican president claims country 'safer' than US following death and kidnappings of Americans
SUMMARY: The president of Mexico claimed his nation was safer than the U.S. after receiving widespread criticism following the kidnapping of four American tourists by cartel members.

TITLE: Catholic priest sues after allegedly being fired from hospital for answering patient questions about marriage
SUMMARY: Rev. Patrick Pullicino, 73, is taking legal action after he was reportedly expelled as a hospital chaplain after answering a patient's question about the Church's stance on sexuality.

TITLE: White House is 'encouraging President Xi to reach out to President Zelenskyy,' but no confirmation of meeting
SUMMARY: White House national security adviser Jake Sullivan said on Monday that Ukrainian officials have not yet confirmed a meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

TITLE: Iranian teen girls hunted by police for posting viral TikTok dance to Selena Gomez song
SUMMARY: Iranian security forces are reportedly hunting down a group of teen girls who posted a TikTok video of themselves dancing to a Selena Gomez song.

TITLE: Kiska, Canada's last captive orca, dead at 47
SUMMARY: Kiska, the last captive orca in Canada, died last week at Marineland in Niagara Falls, Ontario, after spending over four decades at the park. She was believed to have been about 47.

TITLE: Roman aristocrat's millennia-old remains unearthed in northern England in 'once-in-a-lifetime find'
SUMMARY: An ancient cemetery containing the remains of both late-Roman and early-Saxon people was discovered in northern England, officials announced on Monday.

TITLE: 5 dead, 3 injured in attack on indigenous tribe in Nicaragua
SUMMARY: Nicaraguan authorities reported at least five deaths after an apparent arson attack on indigenous Mayangna tribe members in the community of Wilu.

TITLE: Parents pull 4-year-old from church school for promoting 'gender identity' lessons: 'Cruel deception'
SUMMARY: Stephen and Joanne Evans pulled their 4-year-old son from St. Mary's, Prittlewell to avoid having him participate in a book promoting "gender lessons" for World Book Day.

TITLE: North Korea launches multiple ballistic missiles into sea as South Korea warns of 'grave provocation'
SUMMARY: South Korean officials reported two ballistic missiles were fired from North Korea early Tuesday morning, which flew several hundred miles before landing in the sea.

TITLE: Russia sacrificing mercenary forces as 'live meat' after Wagner Group warlord loses 'Putin's trust'
SUMMARY: Russia's defense ministry is using Wagner forces as "live meat" in the Bakhmut sector as it looks to eliminate the group after Yevgeny Prigozhin lost the trust of President Putin.

TITLE: China to reopen its borders, resume all visas for tourists
SUMMARY: Tourism to China will resume later this week after officials in Beijing announced they would be reopening borders for visa and non-visa travel for the first time in three years.

TITLE: Pope Francis says Catholic Church banning priests from engaging in sex is 'temporary'
SUMMARY: Pope Francis said the Catholic Church's ban on sex for priests could be reviewed, saying the rule was "temporary" and there is “no contradiction for a priest to marry."

TITLE: Mexico 'safer' than US following death and kidnappings of Americans, Lopez Obrador claims
SUMMARY: The president of Mexico claimed his nation was safer than the U.S. after receiving widespread criticism following the kidnapping of four American tourists by cartel members.

TITLE: Sweden's prime minister believes it is likely Finland will join NATO before his country
SUMMARY: Finland will most likely join NATO before Sweden according to the country's prime minister. This is because Turkey opposes Sweden's bid to join the organization.

TITLE: Spain collects 445 church sex abuse complaints
SUMMARY: Spain is tackling sex abuse committed by priests and church officials. A commission has registered testimonies from over 400 victims so far.

TITLE: Lebanon's currency hits record low as country's banks go back on strike
SUMMARY: The Lebanese currency has reached a record low. The country's banks have gone back on strike and many businesses in the country are pricing their items in dollars.

TITLE: Mexico 'safer' than US following death and kidnappings of Americans, Mexican President Lopez Obrador claims
SUMMARY: The president of Mexico claimed his nation was safer than the U.S. after receiving widespread criticism following the kidnapping of four American tourists by cartel members.

TITLE: Britain's National Cyber Security Center reviews whether TikTok should be banned from government phones
SUMMARY: Britain's security minister said the country is looking into whether TikTok should be allowed on government devices. Many countries have already banned the social media app.

TITLE: 2 dead, 9 injured in Canada after pickup truck plows into pedestrians
SUMMARY: A hit-and-run incident in a town in eastern Quebec, Canada, has killed two people and injured nine others. The suspected driver later turned himself in.

TITLE: China issues ominous threat to Biden, Australia over nuclear submarine deal
SUMMARY: China warned that the nuclear submarine deal between the U.S. and Australia reflects a "Cold War mentality" that will undermine the region's "stability and peace."

TITLE: Francis marks 10 years as pope after comments on priestly celibacy, gender ideology make waves
SUMMARY: The Catholic Church is celebrating the 10th anniversary of Pope Francis's pontificate with a smattering of messages from the Holy See.

TITLE: Chinese SARs whistleblower Jiang Yanyong dies at age 91
SUMMARY: Jiang Yanyong, a Chinese military doctor who told the media that there were many more SARS cases than what China was letting on, has died at the age of 91.

TITLE: Netherlands returns remains of 9 indigenous people to Dutch Caribbean island
SUMMARY: The Netherlands has returned indigenous remains to a tiny Dutch Caribbean island of St. Eustatius in a new push to preserve the island’s history.

TITLE: Explosive-laden car in Somalia kills 9 and injures governor in extremist attack
SUMMARY: A Somalian governor and senior military officers were wounded in an extremist attack when an explosive-laden car targeted the entrance of a guest house.

TITLE: German police say 2 children are in custody after allegedly killing 12-year-old girl
SUMMARY: Two children are in custody in Germany after allegedly killing a 12-year-old girl. The girl was found dead earlier in the week after going missing on Sunday.

TITLE: Boats carrying dozens of migrants off Turkish coast sink, killing 4
SUMMARY: Two migrant boats carrying dozens of people sank off the Turkish coast. Four people died and many more were taken to hospitals for hyperthermia treatment.

TITLE: ‘Mafia-style attack’ on archaeologist triggers protests in Greece
SUMMARY: Archaeologists in Greece launched a strike action to protest a “mafia-style attack” on a fellow archaeologist, who was left unconscious and bleeding on the street.

TITLE: Revelation that Poland's justice minister was carrying a pistol draws surprised reactions
SUMMARY: A gust of wind revealed that Poland's justice minister was carrying a pistol. He claims he received permission to carry the gun after a crime boss called for his assassination.

TITLE: Cambodia's Prime Minister Hun Sen hints that he intends to step down when new government is installed
SUMMARY: Hun Sen, the prime minister of Cambodia, hinted that he may step down when the country's new government is installed. The new government will be installed after July's general election.

TITLE: Polish activist convicted for helping victim of domestic violence obtain abortion pills
SUMMARY: A Polish women's rights activist was convicted for helping a victim of domestic violence obtain abortion pills. A Warsaw court sentenced her to eight months of community service.

TITLE: Man convicted after he 'stealthed' partner during sex
SUMMARY: While this is the first "stealthing" conviction in the Netherlands, a man was convicted of the crime in 2018 in Berlin, and California outlawed the act in 2021.

TITLE: Blinken travels to Africa as new report shows China, Russia eclipsing US arms sales to continent
SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken will travel to Ethiopia and Niger as the Biden administration works to counter expanding ties and increased arms sales from China and Russia to Sub Sahara Africa.

TITLE: Italy blames Russia for refugee surge, offshore deaths
SUMMARY: Italian officials insist the presence of Russian mercenaries in Libya is responsible for the recent influx of migrants and uptick in deaths off the Mediterranean nation's coast.

TITLE: Mexico medical tourism booms as Americans risk lives for surgeries: 'Worst choice I ever made'
SUMMARY: Justine Rodriguez suffered major health problems for three years after choosing to go to Tijuana, Mexico, for an elective medical procedure.

TITLE: Australia toddler chasing deadly snake leads to nest discovery with 110 eggs
SUMMARY: An Australian toddler chasing a deadly Eastern Brown snake led to the discovery of a snake's nest with 110 eggs as well as two other lethal snakes.

TITLE: Canadian officials insist man intentionally ran over pedestrians in random attack
SUMMARY: Canadian authorities believe Steeve Gagnon acted deliberately when he rammed a pickup truck into pedestrians in Amqui, Quebec, two of whom died.

TITLE: Chinese 'Long March' rocket reenters Earth's atmosphere uncontrolled, disintegrates over Texas
SUMMARY: A Chinese rocket booster weighing approximately four tons reentered the Earth's atmosphere on March 8 over Texas at 17,000 mph, and ultimately disintegrated.

TITLE: Colombian Navy seizes mystery submarine with more than a ton of cocaine, 2 lifeless bodies on board
SUMMARY: Nearly 3,000 pounds of cocaine worth about $87 million were located in a submarine in the Pacific Ocean on Sunday, the Colombian Navy announced.

TITLE: Senators tell Pentagon to 'take a hard look at providing F-16 aircraft to Ukraine'
SUMMARY: Sen. Mark Kelly, D-Ariz., and seven other U.S. Senators wrote a letter to the Pentagon on Tuesday urging it to investigate the possibility of sending F-16 jets to Ukraine.

TITLE: Colombian navy seizes mystery submarine with more than ton of cocaine, 2 lifeless bodies on board
SUMMARY: Nearly 3,000 pounds of cocaine worth about $87 million were located in a submarine in the Pacific Ocean on Sunday, the Colombian navy announced.

TITLE: UK turns Russophobia argument on Moscow, claims greatest threat to Russian society is war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: The U.K. attempted to turn Moscow's "Russophobia" claims on their head after it accused the Kremlin of being the greatest threat to Russian culture and society with its ongoing war.

TITLE: China, Russia, Iran team up for military exercises in Middle East
SUMMARY: China, Russia and Iran are conducting joint military exercises in the Gulf of Oman this week as U.S. tensions with each country have risen during the international conflict in Ukraine.

TITLE: Lebanon's Central Bank chief once again charged with corruption, along with his brother, an associate
SUMMARY: Riad Salameh, his brother, and an associate were all charged with corruption and detained in Lebanon. Salameh failed to show up for questioning regarding a money laundering scheme.

TITLE: Honduras seeks diplomatic relations with China, switching allegiance from Taiwan
SUMMARY: Honduras is seeking diplomatic relations with China, in turn, switching allegiance from Taiwan, which Beijing rejects as its own diplomatic nation under the "One-China" policy.

TITLE: Russia blames US for 'hostile' flights near its borders after forcing down US drone
SUMMARY: Russian officials are denying claims that a Russian fighter jet clipped a US drone in international airspace over the Black Sea on Tuesday morning.

TITLE: UK, Germany scramble fighters to block Russian jets hours after US drone crash
SUMMARY: The U.K. and Germany scrambled jets to ward off Russian planes near Estonia in their first-ever joint action under the NATO treaty on Tuesday, hours after a U.S. drone was downed.

TITLE: German police conduct raid against group of suspected human smugglers
SUMMARY: A group of suspected human smugglers were raided by police in Germany. Five people were arrested in the raid while 12 are still under investigation.

TITLE: Thai police detain senior officer who fired multiple gunshots from his home in Bangkok
SUMMARY: A senior police officer was firing gunshots from his home in Bangkok. He was detained after a 24 hour standoff. The officer was taken to the hospital with an injury after the standoff.

TITLE: Italian court hears final appeal for 2 US citizens convicted in fatal stabbing of police officer in Rome
SUMMARY: A police officer was allegedly killed by two U.S. tourists in Rome in 2019. A court in Italy is hearing the final appeals for the two suspects on Wednesday.

TITLE: US drone downed by Russia latest in pattern of Moscow hostile 'signaling'
SUMMARY: The U.S. has accused two Russian SU-27 warplanes of harassing and downing a $32 million MQ-9 Reaper drone over international waters in what could be described as "coercive signaling" from Moscow.

TITLE: Russian warlord opens dozens of centers to recruit black-market soldiers
SUMMARY: The Wagner Group is seeking to recruit more mercenaries as part of an ongoing recruitment drive. Wagner reportedly has up to 50,000 troops fighting in Ukraine.

TITLE: Italian government limits recognition of parental rights to biological parents only
SUMMARY: The Italian government has limited the recognition of parental rights to only the biological parent in families with same-sex couples. The move was denounced as homophobic.

TITLE: Indonesian authorities arrest 4 foreigners for trying to smuggle drugs into the country
SUMMARY: Four foreigners were arrested by Indonesian authorities for trying to smuggle drugs into the country. A Nigerian who swallowed dozens of methamphetamine filled capsules was arrested.

TITLE: Turkey floods kill 10 in provinces devastated by last month’s earthquake
SUMMARY: At least 10 people were killed in Turkey from flood waters that swept through earthquake-affected provinces. At least five more people were reported missing.

TITLE: Missing man was lured into bathroom for sex, ended up in shallow backyard grave: police
SUMMARY: Fiona Beal denied killing Nicholas Billingham, but prosecutors read from an apparent diary in which she detailed her confession and included details about the murder.

TITLE: Austrian police warn of possible ‘Islamist-motivated attack’ targeting Vienna churches
SUMMARY: The Austrian police said churches and other places of worship in Vienna may be targeted in a possible Islamist-motivated attack. Security has been heightened in the capital.

TITLE: European Union wants to step up naval visits, engage in joint military exercises in disputed South China Sea
SUMMARY: European Union special envoy to the Indo-Pacific region Richard Tibbels announced the E.U. wants to possibly engage in joint military training exercises in the disputed South China Sea.

TITLE: French protestors stage another round of strikes as committee of senators, lawmakers examine pension bill
SUMMARY: A committee of senators and lower-house lawmakers are examining a pension reform bill. Another round of strikes is being staged in response to the bill.

TITLE: UK prime minister gets heat for allowing his dog to roam free in park despite leash rules
SUMMARY: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak breached park rules when he and his family allowed their Labrador pet to roam freely without a leash in Hyde Park, London.

TITLE: Uganda president’s controversial son unnerves country with tweets about succeeding his father
SUMMARY: The son of the Ugandan president, whose tweets are often dismissed as laughable, is unnerving the country after stating his ambition to succeed his father.

TITLE: Mexico’s Defense Department finds 1.8 million fentanyl pills in border city
SUMMARY: Authorities found 1.8 million fentanyl pills and 880 pounds of meth at a stash house in a border city of Tijuana. The pills were likely going to be smuggled into the U.S.

TITLE: Colombian coal mine explosion kills 11, search ongoing for survivors
SUMMARY: A Colombian coal mine explosion killed 11 people, as law enforcement continues to search for survivors. Authorities said the blast was caused by an accumulation of gases.

TITLE: Free diver breaks record depth at 170 feet beneath frozen Swiss lake
SUMMARY: Czech diver David Vencl broke record depth at 170 feet beneath a frozen Swiss lake. Vencl dived near freezing temperatures without a wetsuit.

TITLE: Boat carrying migrants from Madagascar sinks; 34 drown
SUMMARY: A boat carrying 58 migrants from Madagascar hoping to reach Mayotte sunk late Saturday night. Officials in Madagascar recovered 34 bodies from the Indian Ocean.

TITLE: German investigators take down crypto money laundering site
SUMMARY: German investigators took down a major cryptocurrency money laundering website named ChipMixer. The Germany-based server was involved with the dark web.

TITLE: Brazil reintroduces visa requirements for tourists from US, Australia, Canada, Japan beginning on Oct. 1
SUMMARY: Starting on Oct. 1, Brazil is reintroducing a visa requirement for tourists from the U.S., Canada, Japan, and Australia. Brazil's former president scrapped the visa requirement in 2019.

TITLE: UN inspectors say 2.5 tons of natural uranium missing from Libyan site
SUMMARY: The United Nations' International Atomic Agency says approximately 2.5 tons of natural uranium has gone missing from a non-governmental site in Libya.

TITLE: Pakistani police siege of opposition leader's home postponed over sports match
SUMMARY: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan faces allegations he illegally sold state gifts he received while in office, but he maintains the case is purely political.

TITLE: US sanctions former Bosnian security chief
SUMMARY: The U.S. government imposed sanctions on former Bosnian security czar Osman Mehmedagic for alleged abuses of power to enrich himself and collect information on political opponents.

TITLE: Cyclone Freddy dissipates after killing hundreds in Malawi, Mozambique
SUMMARY: At least 225 people are dead and 88,000 displaced in the wake of Cyclone Freddy, a powerful storm system that predominantly affected Malawi and Mozambique.

TITLE: UN envoy claims diplomatic effort to end Yemen war underway
SUMMARY: The United Nations' special envoy for Yemen said Wednesday that "intense" diplomatic efforts are afoot in smoothing relations between two rival political factions.

TITLE: Albania formally dedicates Vjosa River National Park
SUMMARY: The Albanian government has formally designated the nation's Vjosa River a national park, and has set aside $80 million to prevent wastewater deposits in the body of water.

TITLE: UN warns Haitian gangs taking over country, extra police support not enough
SUMMARY: U.N. special envoy Helen La Lime on Wednesday warned of Haiti's increasingly dire gang crisis, and stated that increased police funding and resources have been insufficient.

TITLE: 8 insurgents, 2 kids dead in Pakistani military raid near Afghan border
SUMMARY: Pakistani security forced killed eight insurgents and two children at a hideout in South Waziristan near the Afghan border on Wednesday.

TITLE: North Korea fires launches multiple ballistic missiles into sea ahead of South Korea-Japan summit
SUMMARY: North Korea fired two ballistic missiles toward the East Sea, Japanese officials said Thursday.

TITLE: Trudeau taps former governor general to investigate Chinese election interference claims
SUMMARY: Liberal Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has appointed former Governor General David Johnston to investigate Chinese interference in recent elections.

TITLE: Southern Africa is warned of flooding, landslides following deadly cyclone that killed over 250
SUMMARY: In the aftermath of Cyclone Freddy, southern Africa is warned of potential flooding and landslides. The deadly cyclone ravaged Malawi and Mozambique killing over 250 people.

TITLE: Russian ships at US drone crash site in Black Sea, US official says: 'They wasted no time'
SUMMARY: Russian vessels have already reached the crash site of the U.S. MQ-9 drone that was forced into the Black Sea after being clipped by a Russian Su-27 fighter jet.

TITLE: Italian court orders retrial for 2 Americans convicted of killing police officer
SUMMARY: An Italian court ordered a retrial for the two California men convicted of killing an Italian police officer. The two men were on vacation in Rome during the summer of 2019.

TITLE: Lebanon’s embattled Central Bank chief attends 1st corruption hearing in money-laundering probe
SUMMARY: The Central Bank chief of Lebanon, which is grappling with its worst modern financial crisis, attended his first corruption hearing in a money-laundering probe linked to the governor.

TITLE: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz says country needs to clamp down on 'irregular migration'
SUMMARY: Olaf Scholz announced that Germany needs to clamp down on "irregular migration" in the country. He believes illegal immigrants must be deported.

TITLE: UN nucelar watchdog: 2.5 tons of uranium are missing in Libya
SUMMARY: Tons of natural uranium went missing in Libya, according to a United Nations nuclear watchdog. The disappearance may raise safety and proliferation concerns.

TITLE: Thousands of Hungarian students, teachers march to demand educational reforms
SUMMARY: Hungarian teacher and student groups marched the capital Budapest Wednesday demanding educational reforms, such as providing better working conditions for educators.

TITLE: Polish court sentences man who fatally stabbed Gdansk mayor to life in prison
SUMMARY: A Polish court sentenced Stefan Wilmont to life in prison for fatally stabbing Gdansk Mayor Pawel Adamowicz. Wilmont allegedly planned the crime in a way that the public could see.

TITLE: China, Japan trade accusations over infringing each other’s maritime territory
SUMMARY: Japan and China are both accusing each other of infringing on their maritime territory. China is routinely sending vessels around Japan’s claimed islands in the East China Sea.

TITLE: Indonesian court acquits 2 police officials charged with negligence in connection to fatal stadium disaster
SUMMARY: Two police officials where charged with negligence after firing tear gas inside of a stadium leading to a crowd rush that killed 135. The officers were acquitted by an Indonesian court.

TITLE: Pakistani court extends pause in effort to arrest former premier Imran Khan
SUMMARY: A pause has been placed on the effort to arrest former premier Imran Khan on a graft charge. Pakistani police were ordered to suspend the plan to arrest Khan until Friday.

TITLE: Poland plans to send MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine following urgent requests from the war torn country
SUMMARY: Ukraine is expecting to receive around a dozen MiG-29 fighter jets from Poland. President Zelenskyy has pleaded for supporters to send fighter jets.

TITLE: Austrian police issue terror threat warning for Syrian institutions in Vienna
SUMMARY: A terror threat warning was issued for Syrian institutions in Vienna by Austrian police. Preventative security measures remain in place in the city.

TITLE: European farmers fed up with climate policies shock political establishment
SUMMARY: The Farmer-Citizen Movement party, or BoerBurgerBeweging, will take 15 seats, marking the largest single-party presence in the Dutch Senate for the coming term.

TITLE: 'Never return': El Salvador locks up gang-bangers in new mega-prison with promise of no release
SUMMARY: El Salvador's government has heavily publicized the new prison, providing video of each prison transfer so far, along with pictures extensively showing the inside of the facility.

TITLE: Senior Iranian official visit UAE days after Tehran agrees to restore diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: Days after Iran agreed to restore diplomatic relations with Saudi Arabia in a deal brokered by China, a senior official from Iran, Ali Shamkhani, is visiting the United Arab Emirates.

TITLE: United States plans to defend Indo-Pacific region against coercion, bullying by authoritarian regimes
SUMMARY: A military general from the United States claims the country plans to defend the Indo-Pacific region against coercion and bullying from authoritarian regimes.

TITLE: Poland breaks up Russian spy ring suspected of planning attack on military supply routes to Ukraine
SUMMARY: A Russian spy ring in southern Poland has been broken up after they were discovered to be planning an attack on military supply routes to Ukraine.

TITLE: British authorities ban TikTok from government devices following similar moves by US, European Union
SUMMARY: Authorities in the United Kingdom decided to ban TikTok from government devices. The United States and European Union announced similar bans earlier in the year.

TITLE: Mozambique records increase in cholera cases, Malawi sees decline as countries recover from Cyclone Freddy
SUMMARY: The number of cholera cases in Malawi has declined in the past few weeks, while neighboring Mozambique has seen an increase in cases. Both countries were ravaged by Cyclone Freddy.

TITLE: Strikes, protests, and clashes over deadly Greek rail crash
SUMMARY: Strikes, protests, and clashes broke out in Athens, Greece on Thursday during a strike over a rail disaster. The protesters threw gasoline bombs at police during the riots.

TITLE: Tourists visiting Rome’s Pantheon, Italy’s most-visited cultural site, to be charged a higher entrance fee
SUMMARY: Rome’s Pantheon, Italy’s most-visited cultural site, will soon charge tourists an entrance fee. Foreign visitors over the age of 25 will have to pay $5.

TITLE: Canadian pastor arrested second time for protesting children's drag queen events: 'Sick, twisted perversion'
SUMMARY: Pastor Derek Reimer was arrested and charged for the second time within weeks after protesting drag queen story time for children at public libraries in Calgary, Alberta.

TITLE: Missing 2.5 tons of Uranium has been recovered, Libyan army claims
SUMMARY: The Libyan National Army claims to have recovered 2.5 tons of natural uranium that went missing last week, but the International Atomic Energy Agency has yet to verify.

TITLE: Thai police to be subjected to random physical, mental health checks after standoff with officer
SUMMARY: After a senior Thai police officer was involved in a 27-hour standoff before being subdued by fellow officers, Thai police must now undergo random physical and mental health checks.

TITLE: Rescue operations at Colombia coal mine explosion end; 21 workers dead
SUMMARY: Rescue officials at a coal mine explosion in Colombia found 21 workers dead; rescue operations have since come to a stop. The mine collapsed Tuesday following an explosion.

TITLE: 2 police officers killed in Canadian city of Edmonton
SUMMARY: Two police officers were killed while responding to a call in the Canadian city of Edmonton. No details were immediately released by the police following Thursday's incident.

TITLE: Israeli army raid kills 4, including teenager, in West Bank
SUMMARY: An Israeli army raid has killed four Palestinians Thursday in occupied West Bank. Israel frequently conducts military raids in the region of Jenin refugee camp.

TITLE: Large Russian city's anti-Putin former mayor jailed for 14 days pending trial
SUMMARY: Former Yekaterinburg, Russia, Mayor Yevgeny Roizman, a prominent critic of President Vladimir Putin was ordered to spend 14 days in jail pending trial.

TITLE: 7 killed in mysterious northern Iraq helicopter crash
SUMMARY: Seven people were killed Wednesday night in a mysterious northern Iraq helicopter crash. The helicopter was carrying militants that belonged to the outlawed Kurdistan Worker's Party.

TITLE: NATO mum in wake of Russia downing US drone; 'time to show steely resolve' says expert
SUMMARY: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg has yet to comment publicly on the downing of a U.S. MQ-9 Reaper drone by two Russian SU-27 fighter pilots this week.

TITLE: Moldovan legislators pass bill to make Romanian national language
SUMMARY: Lawmakers in Moldova passed a bill Tuesday that would change all references to the Moldovan language in the nation's constitution to Romanian.

TITLE: Montenegro's president dissolves parliament, sets stage for early elections
SUMMARY: Montenegrin President Milo Djukanovic dissolved parliament Thursday, ahead of what is anticipated to be an early federal election in the near future.

TITLE: Canada to remove mandatory COVID testing requirements for travelers from China
SUMMARY: Canada is removing its mandatory COVID-19 testing requirements for air travelers from China. Changes are due to improvement in case numbers.

TITLE: Dutch hospitals hold 24-hour strike for 10% pay increase, better conditions
SUMMARY: Dutch hospitals are holding a 24-hour strike for a 10% pay increase and better conditions. Labor unions are in talks with hospitals trying to improve salaries and reduce workloads.

TITLE: 3 dead in rioting blamed on gangs in Brazil's northeast
SUMMARY: Riots in Brazil's northeast, blamed on imprisoned gang members, have left three dead. Most of the violence has been located in the state of Rio Grande do Norte.

TITLE: Australian woman hospitalized after deadly blue-ringed octopus bites her multiple times
SUMMARY: A woman swimming at a beach in Sydney, Australia was bitten by a blue-ringed octopus on Thursday, which is one of the most deadly marine animals in the world.

TITLE: China shipping weapons, body armor to Russia: report
SUMMARY: China has been shipping Russian entities "dual-use" equipment like drone parts, armor, and rifles, though it remains unclear whether these are being used in the war against Ukraine.

TITLE: China’s president to visit Russia in apparent show of support for Putin
SUMMARY: Chinese President Xi Jinping will visit Russian President Vladimir Putin next week as Russia's military continues to shell and march troops across Ukraine.

TITLE: Chile culls whopping 40,000 poultry after detecting 1st bird flu case in the industry
SUMMARY: After detecting its first bird flu case in an industrial setting Monday, Chile has culled and buried 40,000 poultry. Authorities have not detected more cases in other areas.

TITLE: Japan, South Korea renew ties at Tokyo summit
SUMMARY: Japan and South Korea agreed to restore their security and economic ties at Tokyo’s highly anticipated summit. The two nations have had a century of difficult history.

TITLE: Pakistani mourners attend funeral for field hockey player who died in migrant boat crash off Italy's coast
SUMMARY: A Pakistani field hockey player died in a migrant boat crash off the coast of Italy last month. At least 67 people died in the boat crash.

TITLE: New Zealand lawmakers, Parliament workers banned from having TikTok on government phones
SUMMARY: New Zealand has announced the country will not allow Parliament workers or lawmakers to have TikTok on their government phones. Other countries have made similar moves.

TITLE: Russia gives state awards to pilots behind US drone crash
SUMMARY: The Russian government has presented state awards to the two pilots responsible for downing a U.S. drone flying through international airspace into the Black Sea.

TITLE: Christian man facing jail for ex-LGBT testimony reported to police by EU equality official: report
SUMMARY: A police report filed against Matthew Grech, a Christian who left his gay lifestyle, was filed by officials with ties to the EU government and an LGBT rights organization.

TITLE: Cambodians celebrate return of centuries-old artifacts that were illegally smuggled out of country
SUMMARY: Cambodians on Friday celebrated the return of centuries-old artifacts that were illegally smuggled out of the country. The objects were displayed at the government's office.

TITLE: Slovakia's government approves plan to send Ukraine its fleet of 13 Soviet-era MiG-29 fighter jets

SUMMARY: According to China's foreign minister the country will not sell weapons to either side in Ukraine's war with Russia. China has maintained it is neutral in the conflict.

SUMMARY: China is claiming a United States lawmaker violated the "One China" principle by visiting Taiwan. Beijing claims Taiwan has no right to conduct foreign relations.

TITLE: China's defense minister set to meet with Russian counterpart, other military officials in Moscow
SUMMARY: The defense minister of China is set to visit Moscow next week. He will meet with his Russian counterpart Sergei Shoigu and other military officials.

TITLE: Russia's entire Pacific Fleet goes on high alert for surprise war games
SUMMARY: Russia's fleet in the Pacific have been put on high alert by officials in Moscow, who are expecting to conduct war games to test the military's capacity and preparedness.

TITLE: France's top constitutional body set to rule on Macron's contested plan to raise the retirement age
SUMMARY: President Emmanuel Macron proposed raising the retirement age in France from 62 to 64. The country's top constitutional body is expected to rule Friday on if the plan passes muster.

TITLE: Former head of China's CDC says there is 'no evidence' coronavirus came from animals
SUMMARY: The former head of China's Center for Disease Control and Prevention said on Friday that there is "no evidence" that the coronavirus originated in animals.

TITLE: Survivor of the Warsaw Ghetto uprising honored on 80th anniversary
SUMMARY: Holocaust survivor Tova Gutstein was honored on the 80th anniversary of the Warsaw Ghetto uprising where Jewish people launched a collective defiance against the Nazis of Europe.

TITLE: South Korea tour bus carrying Israeli visitors crashes, killing 1 and injuring 34 others
SUMMARY: A bus carrying dozens of Israeli tourists traveling in South Korea crashed on a slope as the driver was shifting gears. A 62-year-old woman died in the incident.

TITLE: US forces in Ukraine spark questions over what happens if Russia accidentally kills an American soldier
SUMMARY: The revelation that there is a small contingent of US forces at the American embassy in Kyiv has prompted questions over what would happen if a US soldier were killed in a Russian air strike.

TITLE: Spanish climber leaves underground cave after 500 days of isolation
SUMMARY: A resident from Madrid, Spain, has emerged from a 230-foot cave after setting out to beat a world record by living underground in isolation for 500 days.

TITLE: 7.0 magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia’s Java and Bali islands
SUMMARY: An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0 shook Indonesia’s islands of Java and Bali. While people panicked, no serious damage or casualties were immediately reported.

TITLE: 3 students training to be Alpine guides in Italy killed in an avalanche
SUMMARY: The bodies of 3 students training to be Alpine guides were recovered Friday after they got caught in an avalanche while training along Italy’s northwest border with France.

TITLE: Belarusian air force crews complete tactical nuclear weapon training as part of Russian plan
SUMMARY: Russia plans to deploy tactical nuclear weapons to Belarus as fighting in Ukraine continues. Belarusian air force crews recently completed training for using the weapons.

TITLE: Populist Iraqi cleric announces suspension of his movement
SUMMARY: A populist Iraqi cleric announced Friday that he would suspend his movement for one year. Political leader Muqtada al-Sadr warned that “corruption" was existent amongst some of his followers.

TITLE: 3 Pakistani children killed while playing with unexploded bomb
SUMMARY: Three children were killed while playing with an unexploded bomb at an abandoned house near the Afghan border on Friday. Officials said Afghan refugees previously lived in the house.

TITLE: Spain releases man charged with terrorism for sending letter bombs
SUMMARY: A man charged with terroristic acts for sending explosive letters to high-profile government figures in Spain has been released. The court believed he would not commit more offenses.

TITLE: US, Israel must stand united on Iran nuclear issue to avoid '9/11 with nuclear bombs'
SUMMARY: Former Israeli Prime Minister Naftali Bennett urged the U.S. and Israel to form a united position on the issue of Iran's nuclear potential in order to stop Tehran's ambitions.

TITLE: Dutch prosecutors investigate activist who desecrated Quran
SUMMARY: Dutch prosecutors said an anti-Islam activist that called the Quran a “fascist book" and tore out pages is being investigated on suspicion of insulting Muslims.

TITLE: Experts doubt Mexico's pledge to protect endangered porpoise
SUMMARY: Experts are having doubts about Mexico's promise to protect endangered vaquita marina porpoise. Mexico’s Environment Department has gone back on pledges in the past.

TITLE: Top French council paves way for Macron to raise retirement age
SUMMARY: France's Constitutional Council has paved the way for French President Emmanuel Macron to officially raise the age of retirement from 62 to 64 amid nationwide protests.

TITLE: Iranians mark Jerusalem Day to support Palestinians
SUMMARY: Thousands of Iranians marched in the capital to mark Jerusalem Day to show support for the Palestinians. Iranian state media claimed rallies show the liberation of al-Quds is very close.

TITLE: Senegal gas deal drives locals to desperation, prostitution
SUMMARY: New gas rig off the Senegalese coast promised economic boon and new jobs, but locals complain of lost fishing access, unemployment, and economic hardships.

TITLE: 5 Austrian officials stand trial for harboring Syrian war criminal at Mossad's request
SUMMARY: Five former Austrian officials are standing trial for allegedly providing asylum to Gen. Khaled Halabi, a Syrian war criminal, at Israeli intelligence agency Mossad's behest.

TITLE: Bridge collapse in Kashmir kills girl, injures at least 70
SUMMARY: A bridge that collapsed in Kashmir killed a 10-year-old girl and injured at least 70 others. The bridge could not withstand the weight of the revelers celebrating the spring harvest season.

SUMMARY: The Swiss government confirmed Friday its plan to distribute 1.8 billion francs — about $2 billion — in aid money to Ukraine, after previously facing calls to do more from Western critics.

TITLE: Pakistani police arrest woman for claiming to be Islam's prophet
SUMMARY: Pakistani police arrested a woman Friday for claiming to be an Islamic prophet. The Muslim woman was taken into custody from her home on charges of blasphemy.

TITLE: Spanish foreign minister says country backs North Macedonian EU bid
SUMMARY: Spanish Foreign Minister José Manuel Albares Bueno said Friday that his country supports North Macedonia's bid for European Union membership.

SUMMARY: Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes ordered federal police to interrogate former President Jair Bolsonaro over attacks by supporters after his successor's inauguration.

TITLE: China expands wartime military draft to include veterans and college students
SUMMARY: Beijing this week announced revisions to its conscription policy and said that if China enters a state of war, veterans and college students will be told of its draft list.

TITLE: US Embassy staff in Sudan shelters in place as paramilitary force seizes presidential palace
SUMMARY: U.S. Embassy staff in Sudan have been ordered to shelter in place as civil conflict unfolds between the national army and paramilitary forces.

SUMMARY: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida was evacuated from a campaign event in western Japan on Saturday after a male suspect hurled an explosive device in his direction.

TITLE: Germany shutting down last 3 nuclear plants, relying on coal, natural gas during 'clean' energy push
SUMMARY: Germany began dismantling the final three nuclear power facilities in the country on Saturday, promising to move entirely to renewable green energy in the coming years.

TITLE: A tense wait for an imprisoned son
SUMMARY: Evan Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal journalist, was arrested by Russian security in March, and is being accused of espionage while on assignment.

SUMMARY: The trio sailed on a 44-foot La Fitte called Ocean Bound, which was last heard from on April 4 as it passed the Mexican city of Mazatlán as they headed for San Diego.

TITLE: China says it 'hopes and believes' Germany will support its 'peaceful reunification' with Taiwan
SUMMARY: A top Chinese government diplomat expressed hope that Germany will support its "peaceful reunification" with Taiwan.

TITLE: Mexico resort shooting leaves seven dead, including child
SUMMARY: A shooting at a Mexican resort in Guanajuato left seven vacationers dead, including a 7-year-old child, after a band of gunmen opened fire at the resort.

TITLE: AI's threat to humanity will be far greater if China masters it first: Gordon Chang
SUMMARY: Chinese proposals mandating AI reinforce socialist values and viewpoints make the technology more dangerous to humanity, China researcher Gordon Chang says.

TITLE: Former Indian politician linked to organized crime gunned down on live television
SUMMARY: Former politician Atiq Ahmed was gunned down on live television in India on Saturday, with the three assassins posing as journalists to get close to the figure.

TITLE: Teen suspended for opposing trans ideology files human rights complaint: 'Shockingly discriminatory'
SUMMARY: Attorney James Kitchen filed a human rights complaint on behalf of Josh Alexander, a teen who was suspended from his Catholic high school after protesting transgenderism.

SUMMARY: The United Nations called for a halt to clashes in Sudan over the weekend after three international aid workers and dozens of civilians were killed.

TITLE: Iranian regime directly involved in poisoning hundreds of students in effort to stifle protests: report
SUMMARY: Iran acknowledged the incidents in March when Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi ordered an investigation into a few of the poisonings, with no update in the time since.

TITLE: US CENTCOM launches helicopter raid in northern Syria resulting in 'probable death' of ISIS senior leader
SUMMARY: U.S. Central Command said in a statement Monday morning that its forces conducted a successful helicopter raid on a senior leader and operational planner of ISIS.

SUMMARY: Hundreds of firefighters in France are battling the country's largest wildfire this year. The fire burned over 2,500 acres of land along the Mediterranean coast.

SUMMARY: A Chinese national was arrested in Pakistan for allegedly insulting Islam and the Prophet Mohammad. The offenses carry the death penalty under Pakistan's controversial blasphemy laws.

TITLE: China criticizes US sanctions on fentanyl trade, say they 'undermine' Washington-Beijing relations: report
SUMMARY: A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson says Beijing has filed a complaint with Washington after the Treasury Department announced sanctions to crack down on the fentanyl trade.

SUMMARY: Olkiluoto 3, Europe’s most powerful nuclear reactor, finally began regular production in Finland after a delay of 14 years. The reactor will help the country reach carbon neutrality.

SUMMARY: Two United States financial institutions agreed to help finance a nuclear energy plan in Poland. Poland is moving toward renewable and noncarbon energy.

SUMMARY: Emmanuel Macron, the president of France, is set to address the nation on April 17, 2023, in an attempt to calm public anger regarding his pension reform plans.

SUMMARY: Britta Ernst, the wife of German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, is stepping down as the Brandenburg education minister. She has served as the education minister since 2017.

SUMMARY: The mother of one of the three missing Americans who went missing off the coast of Mexico earlier this month during a sailing trip said her daughter and her daughter's husband were experienced sailors.

SUMMARY: Bishop Stephen Chow, the Roman Catholic Bishop of Hong Kong, has arrived in Beijing, China. This is Chow's first visit to China in three decades.

SUMMARY: The Taliban is closing institutes that aren't supported by government groups and education centers in the southern part of Afghanistan.

SUMMARY: The German Air Force and U.K.'s Royal Air Force worked together to intercept a Russian military aircraft that was flying close to NATO airspace over the Baltic Sea.

SUMMARY: After a Japanese suspect threw a smoke bomb at Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, many residents were surprised by Kishida’s lack of security.

SUMMARY: The German Air Force and the U.K.'s Royal Air Force worked together to intercept a Russian military aircraft that was flying close to NATO airspace over the Baltic Sea.

SUMMARY: The Russian government has released a video of President Vladimir Putin visiting with military officials in the Russian-occupied Ukrainian territories of Kherson and Luhansk.

SUMMARY: The Russian government has released a video of President Vladimir Putin visiting with military officials in the Russian-occupied Ukrainian territories of Kherson and Luhansk.

SUMMARY: Ilya Yashin, a prominent Russian opposition figure, is in prison for eight and a half years for his criticizing Russia's actions in Ukraine. Yashin's appeal was dismissed in court.

SUMMARY: Madagascar is experiencing "catastrophic" hunger in inaccessible and remote areas of the country. The country has suffered through three cyclones since the year began.

TITLE: Credit Suisse lodges $440 million London claim against SoftBank
