SUMMARY: Seismic tremors that shook Denmark with a magnitude of 2.3 were caused by an unknown source. The quakes were possibly triggered by controlled explosions in Poland.

TITLE: Israel, Cyprus working on deal to build natural gas processing plant, pipeline in Cyprus
SUMMARY: Cypriot Energy Minister Giorgos Papanastasiou announced that his country was working with Israel to build a natural gas pipeline and processing plant in Cyprus.

TITLE: Take that! Philippines sends China message on contested islands as tussle brews
SUMMARY: The Philippines have placed buoys around the Spratly Islands to counter Chinese aggression in the South China Sea. Beijing is accused of aggressively sending its ships into contested parts of the South China Sea.

TITLE: Western Slovakia crash between bus and truck kills 1, injures 59 others
SUMMARY: A western Slovakia crash between a bus and a truck killed one person and injured 59 others. The accident closed the D2 highway that links the Slovak capital with the Czech Republic.

TITLE: German prosecutors charge 4 men involved in far-right group with crimes of violence
SUMMARY: German authorities filed charges against four men who are alleged members of a far-right group, following an investigation targeting several of the organizations.

TITLE: Israel's UN ambassador calls for boycott of 'antisemitic event' at world body
SUMMARY: The U.N. is holding its first-ever Palestinian Nakba Day commemoration that alleges Israel’s creation was a "catastrophe," sparking outrage and calls for a boycott of the event by Israel's ambassador.

TITLE: Pacific Island leaders urge rich countries to do more to help control climate change
SUMMARY: Leaders and representatives from Pacific Island nations criticized the leaders of rich countries who aren't doing enough to control climate change.

TITLE: Finnish military training jet crashes, forcing pilots to eject
SUMMARY: A Finnish military jet crashed in the central part of the country on May 15, 2023. The pilots were forced to eject and are currently undergoing health checks.

TITLE: Nigerian Afrobeat star Seun Kuti arrested for allegedly assaulting a cop
SUMMARY: Seun Kuti, a Nigerian Afrobeat star, turned himself in for allegedly assaulting a cop by pushing the officer along a major road in the commercial hub of Lagos.

TITLE: European human rights summit to step up aid for Ukraine to counter Russian invasion
SUMMARY: The European human rights summit declared they would step up their aid for Ukraine to fight the Russian invasion. The two-day summit will include speeches and diplomatic networking.

TITLE: Vatican's Caritas Internationalis elects new leadership team after papal firings
SUMMARY: On Monday, a former Jesuit novice was elected secretary-general of the Vatican’s preeminent charity, Caritas Internationalis. The move comes after Pope Francis had fired past leadership in November.

TITLE: Belarusian opposition leader says ‘be well prepared’ amid Lukashenko illness rumors
SUMMARY: Opposition leader Svyatlana Tsikhanouskaya says everyone must "be well prepared" as illness rumors continue for Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko.

TITLE: Herders in Kenya kill 10 lions, including Loonkiito, one of the country's oldest
SUMMARY: One of Kenya’s oldest wild lions was killed by herders. The government has expressed concern as six more lions were speared on Saturday, bringing to 10 the number killed last week.

TITLE: Nigerian chef cooks for over 4 days straight, breaks Guinness World Record
SUMMARY: Nigerian chef Hilda Baci has set a Guinness World Record for cooking nonstop for over four days, shattering her predecessor's 87-hour endeavor from 2019.

TITLE: Austrian authorities charge two with blasting Hitler speeches on train intercom
SUMMARY: Austrian authorities have charged two people for allegedly playing Hitler speeches on a train from Bregenz to Vienna, Austria, on Sunday.

TITLE: Girl wounded in Serbian school shooting has died, bringing death toll to 10
SUMMARY: A girl who has been in critical condition since the shooting attack at an elementary school on May 3 died on Monday. This death brings the death toll to 10.

TITLE: Ghanaian ex-president gets opposition party's nod in comeback bid
SUMMARY: Former Ghanaian President John Mahama has received the National Democratic Congress' nomination in his comeback bid for the West African nation's highest office.

TITLE: Senegalese police officer dead after clash with protestors gathered over opposition leader's arrest
SUMMARY: A police officer died and several protestors were injured following a clash at a demonstration over opposition leader Ousmane Sonko's arrest and rape trial.

TITLE: Canadian anti-capitalist cafe with 'pay what you can' model shutting down after one year
SUMMARY: A Canadian cafe with anti-capitalist views is shutting down after just over a year in business. The owner blamed "the lack of generational wealth/seed capital."

TITLE: Ukraine shoots down 18 Russian missiles aimed at capital of Kyiv
SUMMARY: Ukrainian forces shot down 18 of 18 missiles Russia fired at the capital of Kyiv on Tuesday, using U.S.-made Patriot missiles to bolster the city's defenses.

TITLE: Separatists fed up with Trudeau want province to break away from Canada, become 51st state
SUMMARY: A separatist group in Alberta, Canada, is aiming to educate Canadians in the province about the possibility of seceding from Canada to join the U.S. amid anger at the government.

TITLE: South Korean adoption agency ordered to compensate adoptee for mishandling his adoption to the US
SUMMARY: A 48-year-old man is suing the South Korean government and the country’s biggest adoption agency for mishandling his adoption to the U.S. in the first case of its kind.

TITLE: German court convicts 5 suspects in connection with Dresden museum jewelry heist
SUMMARY: Five suspects were arrested in connection with a jewelry heist at the Dresden museum. The suspects stole 21 pieces of jewelry containing over 4,300 diamonds.

TITLE: UK considers ‘fighter jet coalition’ with Ukraine as Zelenskyy meets with prime minister
SUMMARY: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visited UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, seeking military aid and participation in a "fighter jet coalition."

TITLE: Putin gives church Russia’s most important icon after ‘numerous requests’
SUMMARY: President Vladimir Putin gifted one of Russia's most venerated images to the Russian Orthodox Church after "numerous requests," Patriarch Kirill announced.

TITLE: Canada's prime minister meets with South Korea's president, will discuss challenges posed by North Korea
SUMMARY: The president of South Korea was visited by Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. The two leaders are expected to discuss the challenges posed by North Korea.

TITLE: 2 skeletons found buried in Pompeii reveal earthquakes accompanied eruption of Mount Vesuvius
SUMMARY: Earthquakes accompanied the eruption of Mount Vesuvius in Pompeii, Italy, according to evidence from two skeletons that were found buried beneath a collapsed wall.

TITLE: Hostel fire kills at least 6 in waterfront city as cops investigate possible arson
SUMMARY: The Loafers Lodge in Wellington, New Zealand, had no sprinklers, and officials have not yet determined if fire alarms went off as the blaze started shortly after midnight.

TITLE: South Africa admits US claims that arms were shipped to Russia ‘still stand’
SUMMARY: Washington, D.C., is still waiting for answers from South Africa on whether arms have been supplied to Russia, as a U.S. senator calls for reevaluating the relationship between the countries.

TITLE: Chinese Leader Xi Jinping's government shuts down advocacy group for LGBTQ community in Beijing
SUMMARY: The government of Chinese President Xi Jinping shut down an LGBTQ safe space in Beijing, China. In the past few years, the LGBTQ space has shrunk in China

TITLE: Former US Embassy employee arrested, held at same Moscow prison as WSJ reporter: Russian report
SUMMARY: Russian media reported Robert Shonov, a former employee of the U.S. Embassy in Russia, is being held on a conspiracy charge at Lefortovo Prison in Moscow.

TITLE: Rape trial for Senegal's main opposition leader postponed due to protests
SUMMARY: Ousmane Sonko, the main opposition leader in Senegal, had his rape trial postponed due to unrest linked to the case. Three people were killed in the unrest.

TITLE: 27 European Union countries adopt new rule banning sale of products that fuel deforestation
SUMMARY: New legislation formally adopted by European Union countries will help reduce the 27 countries' ties to deforestation. The new rules ban the sale of products that fuel deforestation.

TITLE: Early warning, preparedness likely saved thousands of lives during Cyclone Mocha
SUMMARY: Early warning and preparedness was likely the reason thousands of lives were saved during Cyclone Mocha. The cyclone hit Bangladesh and Myanmar over the weekend.

TITLE: Worldwide executions increased by 53% in 2022, rose in Iran, Saudi Arabia
SUMMARY: Amnesty International says executions worldwide increased by 53% in 2022 from a year earlier, with a significant rise in Iran and Saudi Arabia. Numbers in Saudi Arabia have tripled.

TITLE: English scrap metal recycler sentenced to 9 months in jail for 2016 wall collapse that killed 5
SUMMARY: The owner and a manager of a scrap metal recycling plant have been sentenced to nine months in jail for safety lapses after a wall collapsed and killed five migrant workers in 2016.

TITLE: Dozens protest in Tokyo to stop Japan from releasing treated, but still radioactive, water into the sea
SUMMARY: Anti-nuclear activists protested in Tokyo Tuesday to stop Japan from releasing radioactive water from a damaged Fukushima power plant and into the sea.

TITLE: Italian cocaine-sniffing dog finds 3 tons of drugs hidden in banana shipment
SUMMARY: Authorities and a police dog in Italy found more than three tons of cocaine hidden in a banana shipment from Ecuador. The shipment could have been worth $900 million in street sales.

TITLE: School bus and truck collision in Australia leaves 6 children seriously injured
SUMMARY: A school bus and truck collision in Australia left six children seriously injured on Tuesday. Police said the bus was carrying as many as 45 children when it tipped over after being hit.

TITLE: Israeli city Tel Aviv spots a rare, endangered seal sunbathing on a beach
SUMMARY: A rare and endangered seal has unexpectedly visited Israeli city Tel Aviv. The Mediterranean monk seal has caused media buzz after onlookers spotted the creature sunbathing on a beach.

TITLE: Argentine tourist dies after injuries sustained in Mexico machete attack
SUMMARY: An Argentinian tourist who was severely wounded in a May 12 machete attack in Mexico has died. The man died from his injuries at a hospital in Mexico City on Monday.

TITLE: CIA uses favored Russian Telegram app to recruit spies
SUMMARY: The CIA has launched a Telegram channel to recruit Russian spies disillusioned with the war in Ukraine and President Vladimir Putin. A video was posted Monday night.

TITLE: Tribes feuding over coal mine ownership kill 15 in remote northwest region
SUMMARY: Two tribes feuding over the ownership of a coal mine killed 15 people in the remote northwest region of Pakistan. The fighting erupted on Monday between the Sunny Khel and Zarghun Khel tribes.

TITLE: Burma recovering after deadly Cyclone Mocha; at least 21 dead, hundreds believed missing
SUMMARY: At least 21 are dead and hundreds believed to be missing in Burma on Tuesday after Cyclone Mocha barreled into the coastline with 130 mph winds on Sunday.

TITLE: Italian flooding forces residents to rooftops, Venetian authorities prepare to activate barrier in lagoon
SUMMARY: Authorities in Venice are preparing to activate a mobile barrier meant to combat flooding. Residents in some Italian towns were forced to rooftops to evade the floods.

TITLE: 'Injured and exhausted' dog rescued from England's highest mountain
SUMMARY: The Keswick Mountain Rescue Team saved an "injured and exhausted" dog that had scaled Scafell Pike in northwest England's Lake District National Park.

TITLE: Slovak zookeeper found dead in enclosure after apparent lion attack
SUMMARY: Authorities in Slovakia are investigating the apparent mauling of a zookeeper by a lion he kept. The man was found dead in an animal enclosure.

TITLE: China listed as a top offender in annual State Department freedom of religion report
SUMMARY: A new State Department report on religious freedoms finds China is one of the worst offenders worldwide. Other countries including Iran, North Korea, Afghanistan and India.

TITLE: Jewel thieves get short jail stint after museum heist worth over $100 million
SUMMARY: The Green Vault collection in Dresden contained diamond-encrusted items commissioned by Augustus the Strong as part of a rivalry with French King Louis XIV.

TITLE: Alleged Turkish drone strike targets Yazidi militant group in Iraq’s Sinjar
SUMMARY: An alleged Turkish drone strike targeted a Yazidi militant group in Iraq’s Sinjar on Tuesday. Officials reported that three militants were killed in the attack, and one was wounded.

TITLE: Chicken loose on subway tracks halts service in Mexico City
SUMMARY: Service was temporarily stopped Monday in Mexico City's subway system after a chicken got loose on the tracks. One of the workers tossed his coat over the animal.

TITLE: Pakistani officer accused of shooting at girls' school bus, killing 8-year-old
SUMMARY: Pakistani police officer Alam Khan has been arrested for opening fire on a bus at a girls' school he was tasked with guarding, injuring five people and killing an eight-year-old girl.

TITLE: Gunmen kill 29 villagers in latest attack in hard-hit north Nigeria
SUMMARY: Authorities and residents in north-central Nigeria said gunmen killed 29 people during a late-night attack in Plateau state. The attacks targeted remote communities in the nation.

TITLE: Cyprus freezes $1.3B in Russian-owned assets
SUMMARY: The Cypriot government has frozen 1.2 billion Euros ($1.3 billion) in Russian-owned assets managed by companies registered to operate in Cyprus.

TITLE: French first lady's relative attacked as Macron doubles down on pension reform
SUMMARY: French first lady Brigitte Macron issued a public statement condemning a politically-motivated attack on her great-nephew, Jean-Baptiste Trogneux.

TITLE: 2 US consulate staffers, 2 policemen in Nigeria shot, killed in attack on convoy
SUMMARY: An attack on a US convoy killed two consulate staffers and two policemen in Nigeria, authorities said Tuesday.

TITLE: 1-year-old dead, 23 missing after Malawi hippopotamus attack
SUMMARY: A one-year-old child was killed, 13 people were rescued and 23 others remain missing after a hippopotamus capsized a canoe in southern Malawi.

TITLE: Company uses AI to help manufacturers map 'ethical' supply chains, but warns 'its not a magic wand'
SUMMARY: Software company FRDM uses "social listening," which tracks brand conversations and trends, to track instances of human rights abuses and map ethical supply chain issues.

TITLE: Nepal Sherpa guide sets record for most climbs of Mount Everest with 27
SUMMARY: Nepal Sherpa guide Kami Rita reached the 29,032-foot summit of Mount Everest, the world’s tallest mountain, for a record 27th time on Wednesday.

TITLE: 'Truly sorry': Church of England apologizes after mishandling of clerical sex abuse comes to light
SUMMARY: An Anglican bishop has said the Church of England is "truly sorry" for how the clergy handled allegations of clerical sexual abuse against a 16-year-old boy in the 1980s.

TITLE: Russian losses in Ukraine surpass 200,000: Ukraine intel
SUMMARY: The Russian death toll in Ukraine has climbed, with more than 200,000 troops being reported as "liquidated" by Ukraine's armed forces.

TITLE: Company uses AI to help manufacturers map 'ethical' supply chains, but warns 'it's not a magic wand'
SUMMARY: Software company FRDM uses "social listening," which tracks brand conversations and trends, to track instances of human rights abuses and map ethical supply chain issues.

TITLE: Retired U.S. Special Forces member killed by Russian mercenaries in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Retired Green Beret Nicholas Maimer was reportedly killed by Russian mercenary forces in Ukraine this week, and the Wagner Group gloated over his death.

TITLE: Danish Supreme Court rules newspaper did not violate copyright of Copenhagen’s The Little Mermaid statue
SUMMARY: The Danish Supreme Court ruled that a newspaper did not violate the copyright of Copenhagen’s The Little Mermaid statue by publishing a cartoon of it as a zombie.

TITLE: Ex-French President Nicolas Sarkozy to wear electronic bracelet for a year after losing corruption appeal
SUMMARY: Former French President Nicolas Sarkozy was denied his appeal of a conviction on corruption and influence peddling charges and sentenced to serve time at home.

TITLE: North Korea looks to the final frontier as Kim Jong Un readies launch of spy satellite
SUMMARY: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un inspected a completed military spy satellite this week as concerns mount a launch will come in the next few weeks.

TITLE: US issues new travel warnings for summer hotspots in Caribbean, South America
SUMMARY: The State Department issued warnings for seven countries, five of which are in the Caribbean or South America, over concerns of elevated crime and safety for Americans abroad.

TITLE: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan says police are surrounding his home
SUMMARY: Imran Khan tweeted that he could be arrested and police have been surrounding his house. Imran Khan is the former prime minister of Pakistan.

TITLE: Flooding in northern Italy kill at least 8, forces thousands to be evacuated
SUMMARY: Flooding in northern Italy has killed at least eight people as rain continues to pour. Thousands of others were forced to evacuate due to the heavy rains.

TITLE: Russian court orders arrest of prominent film producer, theater director for criticizing war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Film producer Alexander Rodnyansky and theater director Ivan Vyrypaev were ordered to be arrested in Russia for "spreading false information" about the Russian army.

TITLE: Searing Asian heat wave was substantially more likely due to climate change, according to study
SUMMARY: A study released by international scientists on May 17, 2023, claimed the heat wave in southern Asia was made 30 times more likely by climate change.

TITLE: Palestinian militants fire rocket into Israel just hours after agreeing to cease-fire
SUMMARY: Palestinian militants shattered a cease-fire with Israel just hours after coming to the Saturday agreement, launching a rocket into southern Israel Sunday.

TITLE: Chinese fishing boat capsizes in the middle of the Indian Ocean, 39 reported missing
SUMMARY: A Chinese fishing boat carrying 17 people from China, 17 from Indonesia, and five from the Philippines has capsized in the middle of the Indian Ocean northwest of Australia.

TITLE: Bodies of Chinese couple found naked and bloddy in Bali hotel, Indonesian police say
SUMMARY: Indonesian police investigating the deaths of a Chinese couple found at a Bali hotel may have been a homicide-suicide. Authorities suspect the boyfriend tortured his girlfriend.

TITLE: Over 100 schools in Serbia receive bomb threats following mass shooting at an elementary school
SUMMARY: Over a hundred schools in Serbia were warned that explosive devices have been allegedly planted around the buildings following two mass shootings that occurred earlier this month.

TITLE: UAE court orders British trader who orchestrated $1.7 billion tax fraud to repay Denmark's tax authority
SUMMARY: Financier Sanjay Shah, a British hedge fund trader who orchestrated a $1.7 billion tax fraud, has been ordered to pay that amount to Denmark's tax authority.

TITLE: Singapore hangs citizen for trafficking 3.3 pounds of cannabis
SUMMARY: Singapore has hung its second citizen in the last three weeks for trafficking cannabis. The 37-year-old man smuggled 3.3 pounds of drugs in 2019.

TITLE: Sanction busting new Iran-Russia intercontinental railroad agreement seeks to take on Suez Canal
SUMMARY: Russia and Iran inked an agreement to finance a $1.7 billion rail system to connect a major global trade network amid international sanctions.

TITLE: UK, Germany pressure US to decide on F-16 fighter jets for Ukraine
SUMMARY: Leaders from the UK and Germany said the US needs to decide on whether to allow the supply of F-16 warplanes to Ukraine as an international coalition forms.

TITLE: New Zealand police believe hostel fire to be arson; homicide investigation launched
SUMMARY: New Zealand police have launched a homicide investigation Wednesday into a fire that killed at least six people in a Wellington hostel that they believe was arson.

TITLE: Russia agrees to extend Ukraine grain deal to boost global food security
SUMMARY: Russia has agreed to extend a deal that allows Ukraine to ship grain to boost global food security. They will be able to ship grain via the Black Sea to parts of the world that are facing hunger.

TITLE: El Salvador sends troops to surround town after national police officer killed
SUMMARY: El Salvador has sent over 5,000 soldiers and 500 police to a small town after President Nayib Bukele said gang members killed a member of the national police.

TITLE: Britain baffled by shocking surge in death rates last year with no clear cause
SUMMARY: The first few months of 2022 recorded below-average excess deaths before seeing a spike that went above the five-year average in by tens of thousands of deaths.

TITLE: Belarus-Russia border checks implemented for first time since 1995
SUMMARY: Belarus, a close Russian ally, has partially restored security measures along the two Eastern European countries' 770-mile border.

TITLE: Africa's Sahel region seeks aid to fight violent extremism, stop its spread
SUMMARY: Africa’s Sahel region has become a hot spot for violent extremism, but the joint force set up in 2014 to combat groups linked to the Islamic State, al-Qaida and others has failed to stop their advances.

TITLE: Thai police arrest 2nd teenager for defaming monarchy amid renewed debate over rigorous law
SUMMARY: Officials in Thailand charged a 16-year-old girl with defaming the monarchy for messages she posted on Facebook two years ago, adding to the debate about the law allowing her arrest.

TITLE: Turkey protests as German police search homes of 2 journalists working for a Turkish newspaper
SUMMARY: German authorities seized electronic storage media during a home search of two journalists working for a Turkish newspaper, sparking protest from the Turkish Foreign Ministry.

TITLE: Nearly 50 migrants kidnapped by gang in northern Mexico
SUMMARY: Mexico's president and police announced Wednesday that nearly 50 migrants have been kidnapped by a gang in northern Mexico, the latest in a series of mass abductions.

TITLE: Death toll in Malawi hippo attack up to 7, 17 still missing
SUMMARY: Six more bodies, including those of two teenagers, were found floating in Malawi's Shire River on Wednesday, raising the total death toll from a hippopotamus attack on a canoe to seven.

TITLE: Former Bosnia wartime prison guard who settled in US faces federal charges
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors said a former guard at a notorious Bosnia-Herzegovina prison camp who used a fabricated story to obtain refugee status in the U.S. has been arrested on fraud.

TITLE: Hamas calls on Palestinians to confront Israeli victory parade in Jerusalem
SUMMARY: The Hamas militant group in the Gaza Strip called on Palestinians Wednesday to confront a parade planned by Jewish nationalists through the main Palestinian road in Jerusalem’s Old City.

TITLE: Colombia plane crash:  Four child survivors found in Amazon rainforest two weeks later
SUMMARY: Four children missing after a plane crash in Colombia's Amazon Rainforest have been found, the country's president said.

TITLE: Ecuadorian president invokes 'nuclear option,' disbands legislature after attempted ouster
SUMMARY: Embattled Ecuadorian President Guillermo Lasso, one of Latin America's only conservative leaders, has disbanded the nation's legislature after it attempted to remove him from office.

TITLE: Biden embarks on abbreviated overseas trip as debt ceiling deadline looms
SUMMARY: President Biden's planned overseas trip will be cut short. The president will attend the G-7 summit in Japan but won't make planned stops in Papua New Guinea and Australia.

TITLE: China boasts spy crafts could be used as weapons against enemies: report
SUMMARY: While the U.S. is desperately trying to brush China’s spy balloon activities under the carpet, Chinese government sources laid out plans for using balloons as offensive weapons.

TITLE: In Nepal, 84-year-old man attempting to become oldest successful climber gets rescued after getting injured
SUMMARY: An 84-year-old Spanish man became injured while attempting to become the oldest climber to summit all the world’s highest mountains. He was rescued from Mount Dhaulagiri in Nepal.

TITLE: French high court issues decision supporting AI-powered surveillance cameras for Paris Olympics
SUMMARY: The French Constitutional Council backed a new law clearing the use of AI-powered surveillance cameras during the 2024 Paris Olympics, on Wednesday.

TITLE: State Dept. promises to punish North Korea if illicit satellite is launched
SUMMARY: The U.S. State Department has threatened to take further steps to punish North Korea if the rogue nation goes through with its planned spy satellite launch.

TITLE: British MP compared to Putin for saying traditional marriage 'only possible basis' for 'successful society'
SUMMARY: Conservative MP Danny Kruger drew condemnation and was likened to Russian President Vladimir Putin for claiming traditional marriage "is the only possible basis for a safe and successful society."

TITLE: China says Ukraine envoy met with Zelenskyy during talks in Kyiv
SUMMARY: China says its special envoy met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during talks in Kyiv this week. The visit followed a phone call between Zelenskyy and Xi Jinping.

TITLE: Lesotho imposes nationwide curfew in attempt to curb violent crime
SUMMARY: Officials in the small African kingdom of Lesotho imposed an indefinite curfew nationwide in an attempt to stop violent crime after the death of a prominent journalist.

TITLE: Rescue crews in Italy work to reach isolated towns following heavy flooding
SUMMARY: Cleanup and reconstruction plans have begun in Italy following massive rains and flooding. Rescue crews are working to reach northern towns that were cut off from highways and service.

TITLE: US issues new travel warnings for summer hotspots in Caribbean, South America
SUMMARY: The State Department issued warnings for seven countries, five of which are in the Caribbean or South America, over concerns of elevated crime and safety for Americans abroad.

TITLE: India’s top court allows bull-taming sport to continue despite criticism from animal rights groups
SUMMARY: India’s top court has allowed bull-taming sport of jallikattu, to continue despite criticism from animal rights groups. Jallikattu is celebrated as cultural heritage in Tamil Nadu.

TITLE: South Korea signs $130M financial package for Ukraine
SUMMARY: South Korea signed a $130 million financial aid package for Ukraine as it continues to fight Russian forces. South Korea said it is not providing lethal weapons to Ukraine.

TITLE: Death toll in north Nigeria attack tops 80; 7 suspects arrested
SUMMARY: The number of people killed after an attack in north central Nigeria’s Plateau state earlier this week has reached 80, with people still missing days after the violence.

TITLE: UK, Norway sign deal to counter undersea threats from Russian spy ring
SUMMARY: Great Britain and Norway have partnered to counter Russian threats to underwater infrastructure. The two allies met in the U.K. to discuss the ongoing threat from Moscow.

TITLE: Convoy ambush in eastern Congo kills 4, including 3 park rangers
SUMMARY: A Congolese conservation group said that four people died and six others were injured Thursday when their convoy was ambushed by gunmen in Virunga National Park.

TITLE: Driver apprehended after speeding through Vatican gate, reaching San Damaso Courtyard
SUMMARY: A car driven by a suspect believed to be mentally ill drove through one of the Vatican's entrance gates Wednesday night, and was shot at by gendarmes before the driver was apprehended.

TITLE: Chinese comedian arrested after joking about country's military: report
SUMMARY: A stand-up comedian was reportedly arrested and charged for making a joke about the Chinese military. The company that hired him was also reportedly fined.

TITLE: US walks back claim it killed major al Qaeda leader in drone strike
SUMMARY: A man killed in a U.S. drone strike, initially thought to be a senior al Qaeda leader, was actually a poor father of 10 who has spent his life in poverty, according to his family.

TITLE: Wuhan University rule-breaking with AI-controlled satellite experiments: experts
SUMMARY: China may see artificial intelligence as the key tool that can help elevate its forces and allow it to leapfrog the United States for clear superiority, an expert warned.

TITLE: Japan G-7 Summit: 'Critical' meeting for top powers with Russia, China focus
SUMMARY: President Biden will have a key opportunity to bring a number of top countries, including Asian partners, in line on issues surrounding China and Russia.

TITLE: Australian police use stun gun on 95-year-old woman with dementia who approached them with knife
SUMMARY: Australian police used a stun gun on a 95-year-old woman with dementia who was approaching them with a knife. She was sent to the hospital in critical condition.

TITLE: Tourist shot to death in popular Mexican resort town days after another tourist killed in machete attack
SUMMARY: A tourist from Canada was killed in Mexico just days after an Argentinian tourist was killed in the same coastal state that is generally considered one of the safer areas.

TITLE: Mexican volcano known as 'El Popo' rumbles canceling schools in area, 22 million at risk
SUMMARY: "El Popo," a volcano in Popocatepetl, Mexico, rumbled this week. Scientists have been watching the volcano's every move. It is a threat to 22 million people.

TITLE: Sudan's top army general fires former deputy turned paramilitary leader in symbolic gesture
SUMMARY: Sudan's top army general fired Gen. Abdel Fattah Burhan, the former deputy of the country's governing body who is now a paramilitary leader, in a symbolic gesture.

TITLE: 11 dead in China-Vietnam border road accident linked to human trafficking
SUMMARY: A road incident where a vehicle overturned along the border of China and Vietnam has led to the deaths of 11 people. Authorities said the incident was related to human trafficking.

TITLE: British mountain guide scales Everest for 17th time, breaking record for most ascents by non-Sherpa guide
SUMMARY: Kenton Cool, a British mountain climber, scaled Mount Everest for the 17th time. He broke his own record for the most ascents of Everest by a non-Sherpa guide.

TITLE: Direct flights resume between Russia and Georgia despite rocky relations between the nations
SUMMARY: Russia unexpectedly lifted the four-year flight ban with Georgia. Georgians gathered at the country's airport to protest the first flight to arrive from Russia.

TITLE: Suspected Haitian gang members set police vehicle on fire, killing officer
SUMMARY: A Haitian police car was set on fire by a group of suspected gang members. One Haitian police officer was killed in the latest attack against the country's police force.

TITLE: Urgent funding is needed to avert catastrophic hunger in northeast Nigeria
SUMMARY: The United Nations office in Nigeria says at least $396 million is needed to prevent widespread malnutrition and hunger caused by the security crisis in northeastern Nigeria.

TITLE: German doctor convicted over threat by fairy tale loses appeal
SUMMARY: A German doctor convicted of threatening a woman by emailing her an extract from a fairy tale has been rejected for an appeal. The doctor deliberately threatened the employee with death.

TITLE: Object that entered Polish airspace identified as Russian-made rocket
SUMMARY: A Polish official said an object that entered Poland's airspace in 2022 has been identified as a Russian-made rocket. The rocket was made of concrete and is being examined.

TITLE: Spanish towns evacuated as intentional wildfire tears through western part of country
SUMMARY: Towns in western Spain were evacuated as a wildfire tore through the region. Authorities suspect the fire started intentionally since two separate blazes erupted simultaneously.

TITLE: Biden admin reveals plan to train Ukraine pilots on F-16s, 'will decide' when, who will provide jets
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has resisted providing Ukraine with F-16 warplanes, but may now simply step aside as other countries with access to such planes look to provide them.

TITLE: New Zealand, islands hit with small tsunami caused by 7.7 magnitude earthquake
SUMMARY: A small tsunami caused by a 7.7 magnitude earthquake has hit the islands of the South Pacific and New Zealand. The threat passed in a few hours and no damage has been reported.

TITLE: Iran defies US over executions, putting three democracy protesters to death
SUMMARY: The Islamic Republic of Iran continues targeting protesters who took to the streets after the regime murdered a young Iranian-Kurdish woman for failing to cover her hair.

TITLE: German surgeon fired for enlisting help from hospital cleaner to amputate toe
SUMMARY: A surgeon at the Mainz University Hospital in Germany has been fired after having a hospital cleaner with no medical experience assist in a toe amputation.

TITLE: Zimbabwe releases over 4,000 prisoners under amnesty to reduce overcrowding
SUMMARY: Zimbabwe released over 4,000 prisoners under a presidential amnesty in order to ease overcrowding in jails. Former inmates have complained about harsh conditions in jails.

TITLE: Slovak court acquits businessman in retrial over 2018 murder of journalist
SUMMARY: A businessman who was accused of masterminding the 2018 killing of an investigative journalist and his fiancée has been acquitted for a second time by a court in Slovakia.

TITLE: Dozens injured in Thailand tourist hot spot after speedboat slams into concrete post
SUMMARY: At least 36 people were injured, some of them seriously, after a speedboat in Thailand crashed into a concrete post in an incident where the captain may have fallen asleep.

TITLE: Biden administration reveals plan to train Ukraine pilots on F-16s, 'will decide' when, who will provide jets
SUMMARY: The Biden administration has resisted providing Ukraine with F-16 warplanes but may now step aside as other countries with access to the planes consider providing them.

TITLE: Greenpeace targeted in Russian dissent crackdown, top anti-Putin politician spared jail time
SUMMARY: While Russia has declared Greenpeace a national security threat for its pro-Ukraine advocacy, a top anti-Putin politician, Yevgeny Roizman, was spared a prison sentence.

TITLE: Serbian leadership holds rally in defiance of mass gun violence protests
SUMMARY: Right-wing Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic's party organized a rally and counter-protest in defiance of thousands of anti-government marchers protesting over two recent shootings.

TITLE: Child accidentally hangs herself in amusement park inflatable while staff stared at phones: Report
SUMMARY: A Ukrainian child died of strangulation after she got stuck inside an inflatable trampoline while employees allegedly watched and didn't do anything.

TITLE: Obama, Colbert now among 500 Americans banned from Russia

TITLE: France violence: Leaders work out response to riots, victim's grandmother calls for end to unrest
SUMMARY: The French grandmother of a 17-year-old who was shot and killed by a police officer called for riots in France to cease, saying she is not upset with police overall.

TITLE: Australian woman, dachshund mauled by bull terrier weeks before wedding day
SUMMARY: An Australian woman was walking her miniature dachshund at a dog park when she and her dog were attacked by another dog, just seven weeks before her wedding.

TITLE: Ailing Thai elephant returns home from Sri Lanka after years of possible neglect, abuse
SUMMARY: An ailing elephant in Sri Lanka has returned home to Thailand for medical treatment following allegations that the elephant was in bad health due to years of abuse and hard labor.

TITLE: Heavy flooding relieves China from sweltering heat, but displaces over 10,000 residents
SUMMARY: While recent flooding has helped moderate China’s scorching temperatures, more than 10,000 residents were displaced in the province of Hunan.

TITLE: WATCH: Brewery leak turns famously crystal-clear sea water a 'gruesome' color
SUMMARY: U.S. health authorities have deemed the chemical propylene glycol, used in food dye and as an ingredient in coolant, as "generally recognized as safe."

TITLE: Human rights advocates raise alarm over persecution of Indian Christians following Modi's US visit
SUMMARY: Human rights advocates are raising the alarm about the rising persecution of Christians in India amid Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent visit to the United States.

TITLE: 5.4 magnitude quake shakes Indonesia’s easternmost province Papua, no casualties immediately reported
SUMMARY: Indonesia’s Papua was struck by an earthquake with a magnitude of 5.4. There were no immediate reports of serious casualties or damage, but aftershocks may still occur.

TITLE: Army major, junior officer killed during ambush in southwestern Pakistan
SUMMARY: A junior officer and an army major were killed during a search operation in southwestern Pakistan. Another soldier was injured in the attack.

TITLE: Israel deploys thousands of troops, drones in attack on Jenin stronghold in terrorism 'hotspot'
SUMMARY: Israeli drones struck targets at a militant stronghold in the West Bank early Monday, and thousands of troops were deployed in the area.

TITLE: United Nations urges maritime countries to agree on a strategy to hit net-zero shipping emissions by 2050
SUMMARY: Antonio Guterres, the head of the United Nations, is calling for maritime countries to create a plan to reduce its climate-harming shipping emissions to net zero by 2050.

TITLE: New Greek lawmakers sworn in following election victory for conservative party
SUMMARY: Greece's conservative Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis won in a landslide in the country's June 25 election. On July 3, 2023, the country swore in new lawmakers.

TITLE: Downtown Tokyo building explosion causes 4 injuries
SUMMARY: Windows shattered and smoke spewed after a blast occurred at a building in the commercial district of Shimbashi in Tokyo, Japan. Four people were also injured.

TITLE: Germany accuses Poland of continuing to dump pollutants after killing thousands of fish last summer
SUMMARY: Germany accused Poland of continuing to pollute the Ode River after killing thousands of fish last summer. The Ode River runs between Germany and Poland.

TITLE: Former Russian arms dealer traded for Brittney Griner runs for office under far-right political group
SUMMARY: Viktor Bout, the Russian arms dealer traded for Brittney Griner, has joined a radical political group and is running for office in Russia.

TITLE: Mexican politician 'marries' alligator-like reptile in ancestral ceremony to bring good luck
SUMMARY: San Pedro Huamelula Mayor Victor Hugo Sosa married an alligator-type reptile in a marriage ceremony that represents the union of the Chontal and Huave indigenous groups.

TITLE: China clamps down on Christians, fines pastor and wife for running underground church: watchdog
SUMMARY: Pastor Yang Xibo and his wife have been slapped with a 400,000-yuan fine for organizing religious activities in defiance of the Chinese Communist Party, says a watchdog.

TITLE: EU climate chief expresses concerns over China's coal industry expansion
SUMMARY: Frans Timmermans, the European Union's climate chief, is concerned about new coal-fired power plants being built in China. China is the world's biggest producer of renewable energy.

TITLE: State Department warns Americans against traveling to China over 'risk of wrongful detentions'
SUMMARY: The U.S. State Department has issued a new advisory warning Americans from traveling to China over the risk of being unjustly detained there.

TITLE: Tornado devastates Canadian town, damaging homes, killing livestock; no serious injuries reported
SUMMARY: RCMP recieved reports that a tornado struck near the town of Didsbury in Alberta, Canada, resulting in the destruction of homes and the loss of livestock.

TITLE: Sudanese Army calls for youth enlistment to battle rival paramilitary force
SUMMARY: The Sudanese army has issued a call for young people and anyone capable of fighting to join its ranks and prepare for battle against a rival paramilitary force.

TITLE: Ukrainian award-winning writer killed in Russian missile attack on eastern Ukraine restaurant
SUMMARY: Ukrainian author Victoria Amelina died and several others were injured in a Russian missile attack on a popular restaurant in eastern Ukraine on June 27 in Kramatorsk.

TITLE: Protestors swarm Israel's Ben Gurion Airport over Netanyahu-backed judicial reform bid
SUMMARY: Thousands blocked traffic around Ben Gurion Airport's main terminal in protest of conservative Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's judicial reform efforts.

TITLE: Slovak central bank head refuses to resign over bribery charges
SUMMARY: Slovak central bank head and former Finance Minister Peter Kazimir has declared his intent to remain in office, despite grave bribery charges being levied against him.

TITLE: UK endures hottest June on record
SUMMARY: The United Kingdom’s weather agency has recorded the country’s hottest June since records began in 1884. Experts warned that the uncommon temperatures will become more frequent.

TITLE: No clear sign of when Thai opposition party leader will take over after shocking election victory
SUMMARY: It is still unclear when Pita Limjaroenrat, the Thai opposition party leader, will take over after he unexpectedly won the country's election.

TITLE: Peter Hellyer, UK-born writer who chronicled the rise of UAE for nearly 50 years, dies at age 75
SUMMARY: Prolific writer Peter Hellyer, a British-born writer who spent nearly 50 years chronicling the beauty and transformation of the United Arab Emirates, has died at 75 years old.

TITLE: Australia becomes 1st country to allow patients with depression, PTSD take psychedelics
SUMMARY: Australia has officially become the world’s first country to legalize the use of psychedelic substances to treat patients suffering from either depression or PTSD.

TITLE: Thousands of Amazon indigenous are leaving the forest to experience a new life in cities
SUMMARY: Thousands of Indigenous are leaving the Amazon to experience a different lifestyle. Many of them leave the forest in pursuit of an education.

TITLE: Hong Kong police offer reward for information leading to the arrest of 8 self-exiled pro-democracy activists
SUMMARY: A $127,600 reward has been offered for information that leads to the arrest of eight self-exiled pro-democracy activists by Hong Kong police.

TITLE: Drug cartel violence flares in Mexico a day after gang-fighting vigilante gets buried
SUMMARY: Drug cartels wreaked havoc across Apatzingan, Mexico, once again, following the death of Hipolito Mora, a vigilante leader of an anti-gang citizens’ movement.

TITLE: Youth gathering in Swiss city echoes French riots, resulting in shop window smashing and 7 detentions
SUMMARY: Seven individuals, mostly teenagers, were apprehended in Lausanne, Switzerland, following the vandalism of multiple shop windows after recent riots in France.

TITLE: Arrests plummet in 6th night of France riots as interior minister blasts parents for letting kids protest
SUMMARY: France's Interior minister called on parents to control their kids after revealing that the average age of those arrested over the past week was just 17.

TITLE: Hezbollah outposts along Lebanese-Israeli border trigger UN response
SUMMARY: The U.N. peacekeeping force on the Lebanese-Israeli border has contacted both countries' officials over tents set up by Hezbollah on Israeli territory last month.

TITLE: Finland's economy minister steps down after 10 days in office following alleged Nazi references
SUMMARY: Finland's economy minister has resigned after just 10 days in office following accusations he made comments supporting Nazis at multiple public events.

TITLE: Greece rebukes EU border agency's threats to leave country over migrant deaths: 'unthinkable'
SUMMARY: Greek Migration and Asylum Minister Dimitris Kairidis on Monday slammed European border security agency Frontex for threatening withdrawal from the country amid an ongoing dispute.

TITLE: UK police have new expanded powers to crack down on protests
SUMMARY: New laws came into effect on Sunday that would grant expanded powers to British police targeting groups like Just Stop Oil and Extinction Rebellion involved in disruptive protests.

TITLE: US pushes workers' rights in Mexico amid labor market boom
SUMMARY: U.S. officials are pushing for Mexico to adopt tighter labor regulations as its job market expands due to corporate "nearshoring" to ensure supply chain integrity.

TITLE: Turkish President Erdogan delays ratification of Sweden's NATO membership, demands fulfillment of obligations
SUMMARY: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Turkey is not yet prepared to ratify Sweden's membership in NATO, urging Sweden to complete the necessary "homework" before gaining approval.

TITLE: French riots: New report details thousands of arrests, hundreds of attacks on police since violence broke out
SUMMARY: France's Ministry of Interior has released a new report quantifying the damage and destruction after nearly a week of violent protests.

TITLE: Senegalese president foregoes re-election after deadly political violence shakes nation
SUMMARY: Senegalese President Macky Sall has announced that he will not seek a third term in office after widespread political violence threatened his administration's structural integrity.

TITLE: Fundraiser for French cop accused of killing teen surpasses $1M as violence rages
SUMMARY: A fundraiser for a French police officer accused of killing a teenager has raised more than $1 million.

TITLE: Dutch, Luxembourgish PMs push Serbia, Kosovo to defuse tensions under Ukraine war's shadow
SUMMARY: Dutch and Luxembourgish Prime Ministers Mark Rutte and Xavier Bettel met in Belgrade with Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic in a bid to smooth his nation's relations with Kosovo.

TITLE: Russian military claims it prevented Ukrainian attack on Moscow by shooting down four drones
SUMMARY: Russia's military claims it prevented a Ukrainian drone attack on its capital city of Moscow, shooting down four drones and electronically disabling a fifth.

TITLE: Reporter's Notebook: 500 days and counting as the war in Ukraine goes on
SUMMARY: Ukraine will mark 500 days of war against Vladimir Putin's Russia later this week. The Russian's invaded Ukraine on Feb. 24, 2022.

TITLE: Man responsible for attack on German schoolgirls sentenced to life in prison
SUMMARY: A man who assaulted and killed a young girl in Germany last year has been handed a life sentence. The man was found gulity of murder and attempted murder with dangerous bodily injury.

TITLE: Biden Iran policy under scrutiny amid top aide's security clearance suspension
SUMMARY: Growing scrutiny of U.S. Special Envoy for Iran Robert Malley’s alleged misconduct for reportedly revealing classified information has angered some in Congress who are demanding answers.

TITLE: Miraculous escape: helicopter crashes during landing in Swiss Alps, all 5 aboard unharmed
SUMMARY: A helicopter accident occurred during a landing in the Swiss Alps, but, fortunately, all five individuals on board escaped unharmed, as reported by local media.

SUMMARY: Video footage surfaced showing officers responsible for protecting South Africa's deputy president by dragging a man out of a car and brutally assaulting him until he became motionless.

TITLE: Israeli forces conduct major operation in West Bank's Jenin camp, intensifying search for militants, weapons
SUMMARY: Israeli forces are conducting a major operation in the Jenin refugee camp in the West Bank, intensifying their search for Palestinian militants and weapons.

TITLE: Suspected car ramming 'terror attack' wounds 8, Israeli police say
SUMMARY: A Palestinian man in Tel Aviv, Israel, reportedly ran his car onto the sidewalk to run over bystanders, exited the car and began stabbing victims on Tuesday.

SUMMARY: Mexico's president has made a public appeal to American citizens, urging them not to vote for Ron DeSantis, the governor of Florida and a Republican candidate for the presidency.

SUMMARY: Polish climber Pawel Tomasz Kopec has tragically lost his life while ascending Pakistan's treacherous Nanga Parbat, famously known as the "killer mountain."

TITLE: Turkish President Erdogan delays ratification of Sweden's NATO membership, demands fulfillment of obligations
SUMMARY: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Turkey is not yet prepared to ratify Sweden's membership in NATO, urging Sweden to complete the necessary "homework" before gaining approval.

SUMMARY: Hong Kong convicted a photographer for disrespecting the national anthem after he uploaded an edited video to YouTube that replaced it with a protest song.

SUMMARY: The leaders of Italy and Poland are urging the E.U. to put a priority on stopping illegal migration. Poland is one of the first stops for Asylum seekers entering Europe.

SUMMARY: South Korea's military determined the satellite North Korea tried to launch in May was not technologically advanced enough to carry out military reconnaissance from space.

TITLE: Tel Aviv protests: Thousands of Israelis rally over police chief resignation; chaos erupts
SUMMARY: Thousands of Israelis protested the removal of Police Commissioner Amichai Eshed, who claimed he was removed after he refused to use greater force on protests.

SUMMARY: Russian fighter jets flew dangerously close to several U.S. drones over Syria and conducted other 'reckless behavior' in a video released by the Air Force.

SUMMARY: President Macron appealed for calm and order amidst several days of widespread unrest across France sparked by the fatal police shooting of a 17-year-old boy named Nahel Merzouk.

SUMMARY: Members of France's parliament want to ban TikTok, claiming the Chinese app influences youth and encouraged recent rioting in the country.

SUMMARY: Israeli settlement in the occupied West Bank targeted by a Hamas militant who opened fire, killing one Israeli a day after Israeli forces concluded large military operation.

TITLE: German lawmakers fail to agree on assisted suicide regulations

TITLE: Romania eyes F-16 training facility for NATO allies, Ukraine

SUMMARY: A curriculum compiled by an organization in the U.K. instructs children as young as seven about gender identity and pushes the idea that LGBTQ behavior is compatible with their religion.

SUMMARY: Ukraine developed its own artificial intelligence platform after looking at ten others. It used a tailor-made system to avoid handing sensitive data to any company.

SUMMARY: Wagner mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin has been spotted in his hometown of St. Petersburg, according to Russian sources on the ground.

TITLE: 'Nation River Lady' identified 47 years after strangled body found floating in river, murder charge filed

SUMMARY: U.S. officials said cluster munitions would be part of about $800 million in new military assistance to Ukraine for the continued war effort against Russia.

TITLE: Iraq opens investigation into kidnapping of Israeli-Russian citizen who has been missing for months

TITLE: Iraq calls for Islamic Cooperation Committee to address Quran desecration in European countries
SUMMARY: Iraq's foreign minister, Fouad Hussein, has urged the Organization for Islamic Cooperation to establish a committee for negotiations with the UN regarding the desecration of the Quran.

TITLE: 'Improvised and atrocious': Italy looks to leave China deal, reversing decision of previous government
SUMMARY: Italy plans to pull out of the controversial Chinese Belt and Road Initiative, Italian Defence Minister Guido Crosetto said during an interview released on Sunday.

TITLE: 15-judge bench to hear anti-judicial reform petitions, Israeli Supreme Court says
SUMMARY: The Israeli Supreme Court on Monday said a full, 15-justice panel will hear petitions in September against a judicial reform law championed by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

TITLE: Princeton University student pleads guilty to joining mob's Jan. 6 attack on Capitol
SUMMARY: A Princeton University student who was arrested by the FBI in connection with the U.S. Capitol riot, entered a guilty plea on Monday for his involvement in attacking police officers.

TITLE: Senegalese government dissolves top opposition party, restricts internet
SUMMARY: Patriots of Senegal for Work, Ethics and Fraternity (PASTEF) has been dissolved by the West African nation's government ahead of the 2024 election.

TITLE: Greek PM eyes chance to normalize relations with Turkey, but demands rhetorical de-escalation
SUMMARY: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis on Monday noted his government's intent to normalize relations with Turkey amid an improving political climate.

TITLE: UN chief welcomes Kenya's offer to curtail Haitian gang crisis with multinational police force
SUMMARY: The United Nations is open to an offer by Kenya to establish and lead a multinational police force to curtail rampant gang activity in Haiti.

TITLE: Haitians protest American nurse's kidnapping: 'She is doing good work'
SUMMARY: Haitians rallied Monday in Port-au-Prince to protest ongoing gang violence, including a recent incident in which an American nurse and her daughter were abducted by armed men.

TITLE: Drug legalization supporters having second thoughts as overdoses, crime skyrocket in Portugal: 'Normalized it'
SUMMARY: Portugal, a country many say is a model for drug legalization, is experiencing a myriad of drug problems that have some in the country wondering about a change of course.

TITLE: Wagner Group still not recruiting mercenaries following coup, Prigozhin says
SUMMARY: Russian mercenary outfit Wagner Group has not lifted its suspension of recruitment, leader Yevgeny Prigozhin said in an audio message on Monday.

TITLE: Protesters take to the streets of Gaza, demanding better living conditions from Hamas rulers
SUMMARY: Organized by the online grassroots movement "Alvirus Alsakher," several thousand in Gaza marched and burned Hamas flags before police broke up protests on Sunday.

TITLE: Thousands evacuated as Beijing flooding kills at least 20, leaves 27 others missing
SUMMARY: Flooding in Beijing has killed at least 20 people, and 27 others are still missing. Authorities closed train stations and evacuated thousands of people.

TITLE: United States imposes travel restrictions on Hungarian citizens over verification concerns
SUMMARY: Travel restrictions have been imposed by the United States on Hungarian citizens over concerns that many people who were granted Hungarian passports weren't sufficiently verified.

TITLE: Typhoon Khanun lashes Okinawa with strong winds, high waves
SUMMARY: The Japanese island of Okinawa was lashed with strong winds and high waves from Typhoon Khanun. Transportation on the island was forced to halt, and stores closed.

TITLE: Americans kidnapped in Haiti: Non-profit asks public ‘to pray with us’ as details on fate remain uncertain
SUMMARY: Witnesses say that armed men kidnapped Alix Dorsainvil, originally from New Hampshire, and her daughter from Port au Prince, Haiti, on Thursday.

TITLE: Greek authorities plan tougher penalties for arson as wildfires continue to ravage the country
SUMMARY: Authorities in Greece are planning to increase the fines for arson-related crimes by 10 times as wildfires continue to burn across the country.

TITLE: GOP reps raise alarm bells over Iran’s influence in 'American religious institutions'
SUMMARY: The tentacles of the world’s top state sponsor of terrorism, Iran, have reached some U.S. religious institutions, prompting a letter from GOP congressional reps seeking answers from DOJ and DNI.

TITLE: Indian authorities impose curfew, deploy thousands of soldiers to northern Haryana following deadly clashes
SUMMARY: Deadly clashes in India have spread to Gurugram, a city outside of New Delhi. Authorities in the country imposed a curfew and deployed troops in an effort to stop the violence.

TITLE: Population of Brazil's endangered golden monkeys bounces back following yellow fever outbreak
SUMMARY: The population of golden lion tamarins in the Brazilian rainforest is at a high since the effort to save the species began in the 1970s.

TITLE: Deadly militant attack in southern Yemen leaves 5 troops dead, 4 wounded
SUMMARY: In a suspected militant attack Tuesday in southern Yemen, at least five troops loyal to the secessionist Southern Transitional Council were killed, and four others were wounded.

TITLE: Massive cargo ship fire self-extinguishes after nearly 1 week, salvage efforts underway
SUMMARY: After nearly a week of continuous burning, the fire aboard the cargo ship Fremantle Highway, carrying thousands of new cars, appears to have extinguished on its own.

TITLE: India crane collapse at highway construction site kills 16, injures several others
SUMMARY: An accident occurred at a highway construction site in Thane, a city located just outside Mumbai, India, as a massive crane collapsed, resulting in the death of at least 16 workers.

TITLE: Gunmen attack polio workers in Pakistan, killing 2 police officers during vaccination campaign
SUMMARY: Gunmen riding motorcycles launched an attack on police officers who were escorting a team of polio workers during a door-to-door vaccination campaign on Tuesday.

TITLE: Palestinian gunman opens fire in Israeli settlement, wounding 5 before being killed
SUMMARY: A Palestinian gunman carried out an armed attack in an Israeli settlement located east of Jerusalem, injuring at least five people before being shot and killed by an off-duty officer.

TITLE: Israeli demonstrators storm Catholic monastery as controversy grows around historic religious site
SUMMARY: A group of religious demonstrators disrupted a group prayer session at the Stella Maris Monastery in Haifa, Israel, with a protest against the monks.

TITLE: Burmese military government reduces deposed leader Aung San Suu Kyi's jail sentence
SUMMARY: Burma's military government has reduced the prison sentences of deposed State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi as part of a broader clemency effort directed at over 7,000 prisoners.

TITLE: Ukraine troops admit Russia tougher than expected as counteroffensive crawls ahead
SUMMARY: Ukrainian soldiers found that Russian troops had destroyed the roads and laid out mines to heavily impact the advance of Ukraine's counteroffensive effort.

TITLE: Hong Kong government pledges legal changes to safeguard whales following disturbing carcass discovery
SUMMARY: In response to public outrage on social media, Hong Kong's government has promised to consider legal amendments and establish protocols to enhance whale protection measures.

TITLE: Iran closes government offices, banks, schools for 2 days as temps reach triple-digits
SUMMARY: Iran on Tuesday announced a nationwide two-day holiday as a heat wave blisters the Middle Eastern nation, with temperatures topping 120 degrees in some areas.

TITLE: Pakistan's PM calls on Afghan Taliban to act against cross-border militant attacks after deadly bombing
SUMMARY: The appeal from the Prime Minister of Pakistan came in response to the recent suicide bombing at an election campaign rally in Bajur district, which resulted in dozens of casualties.

TITLE: Poland says airspace violated by 2 Belarusian helicopters
SUMMARY: Poland's government on Tuesday claimed two Belarusian helicopters breached its airspace in a potential act of aggression by the Russian ally.

TITLE: Sweden bolsters border controls amid Qauran burning crisis to protect security interests
SUMMARY: Amid Quran burning crisis, Sweden plans to intensify border controls and identity checks to safeguard security interests, following desecrations that sparked outrage in Muslim countries.

TITLE: Australian police charge child care worker with 1,600 counts of sex abuse, including distribution
SUMMARY: Australian Federal Police charged an unnamed 45-year-old suspect with 1,623 offenses related to sexually abusing 91 girls over 15 years, filming it and distributing the material.

TITLE: Saudis pledge $1.2B in aid to Yemeni government
SUMMARY: Saudi Arabia on Tuesday said it would grant $1.2 billion in monetary aid to the internationally-recognized, financially troubled Yemeni government.

TITLE: 13 novelists announced as Booker Prize semifinalists
SUMMARY: Thirteen semifinalists have been selected for the Booker Prize, an award bestowed upon authors of outstanding works first published in either the U.K. or Ireland.

TITLE: California jewelry store hit by smash-and-grab robbers who snatched nearly $900,000 in merchandise
SUMMARY: Three thieves used hammers to ransack a California jewelry store and made off with nearly $900,000 in merchandise, police said.

TITLE: El Salvador deploys 1,000 cops, 7,000 soldiers to rural province in massive gang crackdown
SUMMARY: About 8,000 Salvadorian soldiers and police officers were sent to Cabañas in a massive crackdown on suspected gang activity in the rural province.

TITLE: Colombian president's son charged with money laundering
SUMMARY: Nicolas Petro, son of leftist Colombian President Gustavo Petro, was charged Tuesday with money laundering and illicit enrichment, raising questions about his father's finances.

TITLE: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak makes climate activists seethe in bold move for energy independence
SUMMARY: The U.K. government announced a plan to issue over 100 new oil and gas licenses over objections from environmental groups that have been protesting in the country.

TITLE: Nigerian stowaways survive 14-day trip across Atlantic on ship's rudder, drank ocean water: report
SUMMARY: Four Nigerian stowaways are claiming to have survived a trip across the Atlantic Ocean to Brazil on a cargo ship’s rudder by drinking sea water.

TITLE: Kidnapping of American nurse, her daughter in Haiti deals blow to aid efforts in impoverished nation
SUMMARY: Aid providers are concerned that the kidnapping of an American nurse and her youg daughter in Haiti will impact aid services in the nation.

TITLE: North Korea 'acknowledged' Travis King situation in communications with UN
SUMMARY: North Korea has responded to communications from United Nations Command regarding the detainment of U.S. Army Pvt. Travis King, despite silence toward the U.S. government.

TITLE: American soldier killed in Germany after truck strikes armored military vehicle
SUMMARY: An American soldier traveling in an armored vehicle in Germany died this week after it was struck by a civilian’s semi-truck while merging onto a highway,.

TITLE: Bangladesh court sentences son of former prime minister to 9 years for corruption
SUMMARY: The son of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia was sentenced to nine years in prison for corruption. Zia's son is the leader of the country's main opposition group.

TITLE: Nigerian labor unions protest soaring cost of living under new president, call for government to help
SUMMARY: Unions in Nigeria are protesting the rising cost of living in the country under new President Bola Tinubu. The new president scrapped decadeslong subsidies causing prices to rise.

TITLE: Search continues for missing aircraft carrying trainer pilot, student in Philippines
SUMMARY: A small aircraft carrying a Filipino instructor pilot and an Indian student has gone missing in the Philippines. The weather is hindering local officials' search efforts.

TITLE: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, wife of 18 years announce separation
SUMMARY: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Wednesday announced that he and his wife, Sophie, are separating and asked for privacy in an Instagram post.

TITLE: Plane crashes on busy city street, bursts into flames during attempted emergency landing: video
SUMMARY: Nigerian safety officials confirmed only two people were aboard a plane that crashed in the capital city Lagos and that no one died as a result of the crash or the ensuing fire.

TITLE: Swedish Consulate in Turkey targeted in gun attack; employee injured, assailant arrested
SUMMARY: A Turkish staffer at the Eurasian nation's Swedish Consulate in Izmir has been hospitalized after being wounded in a gun assault at the office.

TITLE: 14 dead in São Paulo police raid as elite officer's murder investigation continues
SUMMARY: The casualty count from an ongoing operation in Brazil's São Paulo state is now 14, as officials continue their efforts to apprehend suspects in an elite police officer's killing.

TITLE: Russia unleashes drone attack on Ukrainian port city, thousands of tons of grain destroyed
SUMMARY: A Russian drone attack in a Ukrainian port city on the Romanian border caused massive fires and destroyed thousands of tons of grain. Three Ukrainian ports are still operating.

TITLE: Pope Francis laments 'secularism, indifference to God,' urges recommitment to Jesus at World Youth Day vespers
SUMMARY: Pope Francis urged courage in the face of secularized culture and indifference to God during his vespers address on Wednesday at the Jerónimos Monastery in Portugal.

TITLE: Death toll climbs to 63 in suicide bombing at Pakistan pro-Taliban rally
SUMMARY: The death toll from a suicide bombing during a rally organized by a pro-Taliban Islamist party in Pakistan over the weekend has surged to 63.

SUMMARY: A group of armed men targeted a Central African village Wednesday, executing 13 locals at point-blank range and leaving two others injured.

TITLE: Toddler drowns after parents cooking dinner leave her in harness on boat
SUMMARY: A sailing club owner said locals in Fiji and New Zealand regularly tether people in as a safety precaution and couldn't explain how the toddler would have gotten free.

SUMMARY: A German heavy metal festival is opening today at reduced capacity due to persistent heavy rains that caused the grounds to be muddy. Organizers were forced to halt new arrivals.

TITLE: Taiwan detains military officer and collaborators over alleged espionage for China
SUMMARY: Authorities in Taiwan have taken into custody a lieutenant colonel along with several associates, on suspicion of engaging in espionage activities with China.

TITLE: Vietnam will export 2M doses of swine fever vaccine to Philippines by October
SUMMARY: Vietnam granted approval for two African swine fever vaccines and has announced its intention to export two million doses to the Philippines by October.

SUMMARY: Secretary of State Antony Blinken announced that the State Department had implemented a temporary departure order from the U.S. embassy in Niger following a military takeover.

TITLE: South Korean administration will 'never' pursue end to Korean War, reunification minister says
SUMMARY: The current South Korean administration will "never" seek a formal end to the Korean War, Reunification Minister Kim Yung-ho said on Thursday.

SUMMARY: A group of Greenpeace members climbed to the roof of British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's home in North Yorkshire and unfurled large black drapes to protest recent oil policies.

SUMMARY: A man in his 60s died from his wounds while at least a dozen others suffered injuries from both the vehicular ramming and the indiscriminate stabbing in the mall.

SUMMARY: Reports indicate the former commander and deputies of China's Rocket Force took advantage of their position for monetary gain, while others accuse Xi Jinping of a loyalty purge.

SUMMARY: Pope Francis held private audiences with various laity groups on Wednesday as he leads Catholic celebrations of World Youth Day in Lisbon, Portugal.

SUMMARY: The mother of detained American soldier Travis King has a message for his captors in North Korea, saying she wants to hear her son's voice.

SUMMARY: A bus tumbled off the side of a highway in Mexico, leading to 15 people's deaths. Around 21 other passengers were injured in the accident.

SUMMARY: Alexei Navalny, an imprisoned Russian opposition leader, is expecting a verdict in his latest criminal trial. The opposition leader said that he's expecting a lengthy prison sentence.

SUMMARY: Russia pulled out of a wartime agreement with Ukraine to allow grain shipments to the world. Now prices of food across the world are rising.

SUMMARY: China's aging workforce and increasing wage demands have created immense pressure on its production, forcing officials to look to automated workforce capabilities.

SUMMARY: The greater precision and range would reduce the number of missiles required for attacks, bringing down the costs of production and improving their overall performance.

SUMMARY: The atomic bomb was dropped in Hiroshima, Japan on Aug. 6, 1945, during World War II. A second bomb was dropped in Nagasaki three days later. The bombs forced the nation's surrender.

SUMMARY: Ron Dermer, Israel's strategic affairs minister, takes issue with criticism of the country's judicial reforms. As protests continue, minister gives Netanyahu government's take on the overhaul.

SUMMARY: A U.K. army veteran is being criminally charged for praying silently in a "buffer zone" outside an abortion clinic, and is expected to plead "not guilty" in court next week.

SUMMARY: Afghan commando who fought alongside U.S. Special Forces teams has escaped his homeland, but has no status as an illegal immigrant in a third country while hoping for U.S. policy change that would protect his life.

SUMMARY: Dozens of migrants on two boats that shipwrecked off the southern coast of Italy were rescued over the weekend, with at least two reported dead.

SUMMARY: At least two dozen people died after a bus heading to a local market crashed in central Morocco. The incident was one of Morocco’s most tragic accidents in recent history.

SUMMARY: Pope Francis addressed young people in the crowd of an estimated 1.5 million attendees of the Catholic festival at Parque Tejo in Lisbon, Portugal.

SUMMARY: A major two-day Amazon Summit opens in Belem on Aug. 8, 2023. Governments of multiple countries are set to discuss strategies to save the rainforest.

SUMMARY: China unveiled the "Chasing Dreams" docuseries showcasing the People's Liberation Army’s preparation to invade the democratic, self-ruled island of Taiwan.

TITLE: 11 killed in northeastern Congo following rebel attack, according to local official

TITLE: Pope Francis says recovery from recent abdominal surgery is going well, comments on recent Portugal speeches
SUMMARY: Pope Francis told reporters that his recovery from his recent surgery is going well. He also commented on his recent speeches in Portugal.

TITLE: Hong Kong court refuses to ban popular protest song, government plans to appeal decision
SUMMARY: A court in Hong Kong refused to ban a popular protest song on July 28, 2023. lawmakers in the country plan to appeal the court's decision.

TITLE: Japan raises concern over Iranian uranium program, Middle East's suspected supplying of drones to Russia
SUMMARY: Japan's Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi expressed concern over Iran's uranium enrichment program and the Middle East's suspected supplying of combat drones to Russia.

TITLE: Philippine government summons Chinese ambassador over China's use of water cannons during confrontation

TITLE: Maldivian President Solih set to face off against 7 other candidates in next month's election
SUMMARY: Ibrahim Mohamed Solih, the president of the Maldives, is set to face off against seven other candidates in next month's presidential elections.

TITLE: UK moves asylum-seekers to a barge to cut costs of sheltering migrants

SUMMARY: At least 21 people were killed by rebel groups in northeastern Congo over the weekend. One of the rebel groups has ties to the Islamic State group.

TITLE: Rail services in southern Pakistan partially restored a day after 30 people were killed in derailment
SUMMARY: Rail services in southern Pakistan have been partially restored following a derailment that killed 30 people and injured dozens of others.

TITLE: 3 hikers found dead near notorious ridge in Scottish Highlands

TITLE: Imprisoned former Pakistani PM Imran Khan plans to challenge graft case
SUMMARY: Imprisoned former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan met with his lawyer Monday, reportedly planning a potential challenge to the graft case that resulted in his conviction.

TITLE: Teen boy killed, woman injured on French amusement park ride: report

TITLE: Argentines ask patron saint of work for jobs as economy tanks, elections loom
SUMMARY: Argentines lined up Monday morning in their yearly pilgrimage to the shrine of St. Cayetano, asking the patron saint of work for economic relief.

TITLE: Brazilian census reveals country’s Indigenous people has nearly doubled its previous population count
